I mention this in the video portion of the review, but ALL infrared night vision baby camera have poor resolution in the dark. They just do... I have tried four separate cameras and none of them offer a clear picture in the dark. They are all fuzzy and it is difficult to distinguish any level of detail. Another observation.... it seems like the bigger the display the WORSE the picture becomes when using night vision. I guess the resolution of the cameras are all about the same, but when you blow it up to a bigger screen, you lose additional detail. Soooo.... the Samsung SEW-3036NW baby monitor really does not have great picture when you are using it in the dark. The good news? It really doesn't matter too much.Why doesn't it matter? When we are using the camera at night we are trying to see a few basics, is our daughter still in bed, is she sitting up, and other big types of things. What are not trying to do is distinguish if she is smiling or has something in her hand. The Samsun SEW-3036WN works well enough for the big things, but like all baby monitors, it will struggle to pull out the details (although they all will distinguish between *open* and *closed* eyes.Notes--The Samsung SEW-3036WN will allow you to talk to you child through the camera. This is more important that it may seem - it is always nice to be able to ask "What is the matter"- The range on the camera seems more than accurate - 800' seems a little over-generous, but it certainly has enough range for our home.- The daytime camera resolution is very good- The camera has the ability to zoom and pan - although zooming in at night lessens the already poor resolution- The camera can be mounted to the wall, but it does not come with a mounting clip (like the Levanas)- Can support up to 4 camera from one monitor/display- Has a built in clock- Has the ability to be used with voice activated controls - but we have found that just leaving the camera on seems to work better for us.- Very large 3.5" screen - although it does cost use some picture clarity/resolution- The display is fully rechargeable - The battery life seems to be in the 6-8 hour rangeFinal Verdict - The Samsung SEW-3036NW is a very nice baby monitor, but like all infrared baby monitors, it does have its limitations in low light situations.4 1/2 Stars

Reviews.Title: A Great Brand New Video Monitor From Samsung - Detailed Review
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I consider myself pretty tech savvy and I enjoy my electronics. So in anticipation for my son's birth in November, I started an intensive research on various video monitors. There're a lot of choices out there but I stumbled on Samsung video monitors.At a first glance, I think Samsung has the best look and design out of all the video monitors out there; simple and attractive. I love the big screen and simple design. There's nothing to figure out, everything is simple. You play around with it for about 5 minutes and you know what you have. I've seen a lot of various monitors and most of them are cheap looking or bulky... or they're way too complicated.The Samsung brand also sold me. I love their TVs and I love their phones... I figure they'd do a great job for their baby monitor as well.Out of all of Samsung's monitors, I zeroed in on the SEW-3036. I bought it to test it out and get used it...to make sure it's going to be a dependable monitor for our son. Our first child, so you can get pretty obsessive.I was impressed with the video and sound. Video, both day and night time, is the best I've seen. Sound is clear and their two way talk button is a very convenience feature. I can imagine using it to talk to my baby as well as my wife...  The audio on this camera is very stable. Usually when a microphone and speaker is involved...there is a lot of feedback. This monitor, as long as you don't have the monitor volume at the highest, the feedback is almost non-existent.The battery life on this monitor is also very impressive. I tested and fiddled with it all day long and the parent unit just kept on going. The parent unit comes with something called the `Vox'. It's pretty useful. If your monitor doesn't detect sound for a minute, it'll go to sleep. If it hears something, it comes back on. It makes the battery life last even longer.A list of its other features, it has a zoom button with a pretty clear 2x zoom but I found myself not using it much. But it's nice that it's there if you need it.  It has a scan mode that I might use if I had more cameras. You can connect up to four...I don't know if I'll need that many, but that's pretty good. I guess you can put the cameras in multiple rooms; something I think I'll need when my kid gets bigger and starts walking.Overall, it's a great system. The price isn't bad. I found more expensive comparable units or inferior units more expensive. Samsung has made the right choice. They brought down the price and focused on the most important features to make the SEW-3036 a very solid monitor. I've played around with it for a couple of days now and I really think it's going to make things  a lot easier for me and my wife.  A very excited soon-to-be dad here writing what I found! I'll update the review after I try it out with my baby!!!! But so far, I am very very impressed!

Reviews.Title: Night Vision blinks out every 3 seconds.
Reviews.Author: Carina
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this baby monitor. I love the samsung brand. I have a Samsung galaxy phone and tablet and really enjoy them, but this baby monitor does not compare at all. For six months I have been using the Levana 32102 Era Advanced, it is much cheaper than this monitor and has a smaller screen but I must say I think I like that one much better than this samsung one.First, whenever you turn on this baby monitor it plays a little tune. Which isn't good in my house because usually I am using the baby monitor when my baby is sleeping and this tune is loud enough to wake him from another room. Plus I am in the habit of turning on the monitor before I leave the room and I have woke him a couple times because of the tune this monitor plays when it boots up. Very annoying.Then, I usually use this in the mornings when I am getting ready for work and it is still dark so I use the night vision a lot. But the night vision on this monitor blacks out every 3 seconds, then shows the feed for 3 seconds then blacks out for another 3 seconds the entire time it is on! It is frustrating. What is happening it is goes from night vision to regular mode every 3 seconds! And because the room is dark I only see a black screen. During the day when I use it, it also cycle through from night vision to regular mode every 3 seconds, it is so annoying!Also, the quality of the video is horrible. It is not crisp at all. It is blurry and the color is horrible. The color on the screen looks blurry in night vision an fuzzy in regular. One time I couldn't even figure out how my baby was positioned because the quality is so horrible. The Levana 32102 Era Advanced screen is smaller but the quality is much more crisper and I can see my baby breath and everything from that screen. I love the size of the samsung baby monitor screen but what good does it do when the video is blurry, bad quality and bad color? Plus, it blinks in and out every three seconds from night vision to regular so it frustrates me even more!The camera can sit on flat surface or hang on the wall and it comes with two screws if you want to go with the latter option. I hung my on the wall and the camera does move very well so you can get it to the right angle to see your baby in the crib. It moves up, down, side to side, back and forth. So, one of the pluses is the camera has good angles that you can have it anywhere and position the camera.There is a sleep button on the monitor so you can turn off the video and hear only. There is also a VOX option which blinked off and on from night vision to regular as well every 3 seconds.Overall I am disappointed with the blinking off and on every 3 seconds. It is harder to focus on what is going on when it constantly goes to from night vision to regular mode. It doesn't matter what the lighting is in the room it does it no matter what making me not want to use this monitor. Guess I will stick to my cheaper Levana 32102 Era Advanced.**********Update 5/15/2013********************I updated my review based what another customer told me. He told me that to stop it from going from night vision to regular vision is to put black tape over the sensor found below the power on/off switch. I put some black duct tape over it and now when it is dark in my baby's room it no longer cycles through every 3 seconds from night vision to regular. HOWEVER, it still goes back and forth when there is light in the room during the day. But, it isn't as noticeable, just a bit of a color change every 3 seconds. I can deal with that, I hated it when it would go completely black when it went out of night vision in the dark. And this fixes that. But still it has the annoying tune when turning it on, so it really only goes up a half a star for me because of that and it still blinks in and out during the day too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent video monitor for the price!
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I have a new born baby and searched a video baby monitor.There were many baby monitor on sale and I started compare them with my needs.I chose three baby monitors, Motorola MBP36, Infant Optics DXR-5, and Samsung sew-3036wn.First of all, I removed infant optics because I thought video screen should be big enough.Motorola and Samsung have 3.5 inch screen.  I compared Motorola and Samsung functions in detail. It came down to the Pan and tilt function vs a $60 discount. I selected $60 discount. I thought I will just put my baby in the crib, so I won't need pan and tilt function that much.Furthermore, Samsung model has sound wake up function which is called VOX, and it looks very cool to me.When I get Samsung baby monitor on hand, the first feeling is that the design looks cool. It has very simple and great design. The video display was not excellent t but clear enough. The night vision was fine. The battery life was even longer than written in manual. With continuous video display, it goes about 4 hours and with auto sleep mode, it goes over 6 hours! The sound is super clear. My baby sleeps on the second floor and I put the baby monitor on my kitchen desk. I realized just how great the sound was on this monitor as I was climbing upstairs. Hearing both my baby upstairs and the sound from the monitor downstairs, I couldn't tell them apart. It sounded like I was listening to my baby surround sound.The most satisfied function is VOX! It's so cool function and works very well. When I turn this function on, the video display automatically turns off when my baby makes no sounds, and the video turn on immediately when it detects sound. . It gives me a signal with sound when my baby makes noise so I don't have to pay attention to baby monitor when my baby is sleeping. There is no constant background noise as well. I love this function.I love this monitor and now looking for an additional camera for my baby play yard use.

Reviews.Title: Not Very Impressive
Reviews.Author: Sherry Barr
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to see so many positive reviews for this monitor.  I've waited to write a review until I had the opportunity to use this product for several weeks.  My only other experience with a baby monitor is a Summer monitor which I'ved used for hours each day and throughout the night for the past almost 3 years (I actually have two of them, which I love). However, the Samsung pales in comparison and it seems considerably overpriced.There are several features of the Samsung monitor that I find problematic:1) The resolution is poor. While one is typically using the monitor to make sure his/her child is still in bed or out of harm's way, so seeing in detail with great resolution isn't really a necessity, I was still surprised at how poor the resolution is - it does have a larger than average screen, but I don't see the point of a large screen with poor resolution.  A smaller screen with better resolution seems to make a lot more sense to me.2) The battery life is terrible.  The system comes with a power cord and most of the time it needs to be used while plugged in.  It's also possible to use it in "sleep mode" which means less battery power is used, but you can't see your child unless there's noise detected by the camera. I prefer to keep the picture view on while I'm using it as my child sometimes gets up and gets out of bed without making a sound. When the battery does get low, there is a battery low indicator to let you know, but it's typcially only a minute or two until the monitor dies completely and it must be plugged in.3) You want to make sure you don't forget to check that the camera is in view of your baby/child before he/she falls asleep because the monitor makes an obnoxious sound when powered on - one that would likely wake up anyone else sleeping in the room, especially your baby.4) It's very easy to touch the wrong button on the monitor which then means that the camera and monitor must be "paired" again - this means walking into your child's room to touch a button on the camera to make this happen.  This is not good at all if it happens when your child who doesn't sleep well to begin with is finally fast asleep5) The cord on the camera is very short, which reduces your options for where you can place the camera in relation to an outlet.  Mounting the camera in the corner of a room is not an option.6) The menu/navigation seems primitive - it feels like my first computer (in terms of functinality, this is irrelevant, but given the price point, I expected something a bit more advanced.The only real positive features I can see are that it has the capacity to integrate multiple cameras and it has a "talk" feature where you can talk to your child.Overall, I was very disappointed by this baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: I actually bought this product and use it...
Reviews.Author: CK
Reviews.Content: In summary this is a nice monitor, not without it's issues but still good.  I had a summer infant monitor and it broke on me. This monitor will be its replacement.Pros--big screen-video quality is decent in both light and dark situations.  It's not hd but you can see clearly.-easy to navigate, with volume control on the unit as buttons-able to use video without sound or sound without video-time is displayed on monitor-light weight-2 way talk feature-easy to switch between multiple cameras (I don't have multiple cameras, but the button to change cameras is prominent on the unit)-sound is fine. Again not hd, but do you really want to hear your kid cry in hd?!-vox feature works well and saves you from having to press a button to see what's happening with your child-has some pan and zoom-no issues with range in my 3000 sq ft home-no issues with interference with my wifi or other the neighbor's monitorsCons--battery life isn't great. Doesn't work more than 1 night without a charge.-Doesn't stand up on its own without using the kick stand-kick stand is a bit flimsy and not easy to pull out-pan and zoom aren't great, but I'm still glad to have them even as limited as they are-speaker is in the back of the monitor. This makes it hard to hear at low volume settings.-when turned from the off to the on position, the monitor plays a Samsung tune. It is annoying especially if your partner is sleeping. It cannot be muted.

Reviews.Title: Blinks, now stop to work
Reviews.Author: Lenisa
Reviews.Content: the baby monitor blinks all night, on and off the infrared. With 40 days the parent monitor displays the message "out of range" even being in the same room as the camera. It doesnt work!!! I'm disappointed with samsung!!!!

Reviews.Title: Bad Range, Interferes with WiFi, Beeps ALL the time!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Samsung SEW-3036WN Wireless Video Baby Monitor Night Vision and Zoom, 3.5 inchWe bought this unit from Target new as a replacement for our Summer Infant Slim & Secure Handheld Color Video Monitor 2.4 GHz Pink Baby Girls that just died while on a trip for my sister's wedding. The Summer Infant unit worked flawlessly for the last two years and just died suddenly at the rental house (looks like the wiring was from the early 1900s). After this, I'm going to be buying a replacement camera as the handheld unit works just fine.Now, back to the SEW-3036WN.Let's get started with the Pros:-2x digital zoom (Summer Infant model didn't have this feature)-decent night vision (Summer Infant was tied here)-large screen 3.5 in. (Larger than the Summer Infant Model)-decent resolution (Better than the Summer Infant Model)-easy user interface (More features than the Summer Infant Model, but can be confusing if you don't use all the features)-simple pairing procedure once you read the manual (Summer Infant's pairing was easier. You just press the button on the back of the camera.)-2-way talk feature(Not that you'll ever use this but to mess with your child. My wife hates when I do this.)Cons:-Loses signal often even at 40 ft from the camera. (To be fair, the Summer Infant also lost signal at this range, but didn't beep. Re-acquired signal easily) We run at least 2 Netflix streams on WiFi @ 2.4GHz. Adding the Samsung to the household now makes some of the computers have to reset their wireless adapters (Disable/Enable in Windows, reboot the PS3) I know you're going to tell me to switch the wireless over to the 5GHz band, but not all computers have WiFi adapters that use the 5GHz band. My Astro A50s use this band already with no issues. Turning off the camera and base removed interference for my WiFi (tested in 2 houses).-Beeps every time it loses connection. This was tested in the vacation house at my sister's wedding, as well as our own home. Unreliable even if close to the camera/transmitter. (The Summer Infant Model doesn't beep. It just shows a small error message and then reconnects.)-Sound is not very clear in comparison to the Summer Infant model.Overall:If you don't have any 2.4GHz devices in the home, and you don't live in a community that uses any other 2.4GHz devices, you should be good with this unit. Test range. Your mileage may vary.If you happen to live in a neighborhood with large amounts of interference from overlapping WiFi networks, Bluetooth, or anything that operates on the 2.4GHz bands, I wouldn't recommend this unit.I'm writing to with two purposes here. One, to help others make informed decisions. And two, to try to get Samsung to make a better Baby Monitor. I'm a big Samsung fan. I've used lots of devices, from their MP3 players to HDTVs and I adore the quality of the brand. And I do say this with all the civility I can muster, "This product is not as good as similar priced models from Summer Infant." No I'm not a Summer Infant salesman or shill, but an owner. (I'm going to be debugging the bad camera to see if I can get it working again - I like the Summer infant model so much...Thank you for reading.

Reviews.Title: Very Mediocre
Reviews.Author: J. Finkel "Jack of Trades"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung SEW-3036WN is my third baby monitor.  I have previously used Summer Infant Best View Handheld Color Video Monitor, Sliver/White and Motorola MBP33 Wireless Video Baby Monitor with Infrared Night Vision and Zoom, 2.8 Inch.  The Samsung SEW-3036WN falls somewhere in the middle, but does have some strong points and weak points relative to the other monitors.The best selling points of the Samsung monitor are its modern, streamlined appearance and slim camera.  The 'Vox' setting, which conserves battery life by going into sleep mode after a short period of silence is a great idea, but isn't sensitive enough for me.  In order to wake up the monitor, I need to snap my fingers quite loudly from a few feet away.  I prefer hearing when my child is awake even when they are not screaming or making a commotion.  I think other parents may like the Vox mode though and it does work as promised.  It may help lighter sleeping parents avoid waking up needlessly at night.  The screen is decent at 3.5 inches but the resolution is only 320x240, so you certainly won't see the promised 640x480 resolution from the camera.  Also, the colors on the screen are extremely washed out even in moderate lighting.The biggest weakness of this monitor is that you cannot control the direction of the camera remotely.  Most monitors, certainly in this price range, have this function.  I also found that with only 1 wall, the range was under 100 ft.  This falls well short of the promised 800 ft. range.  I had trouble using the monitor initially.  It took many tries to get it to stay connected to the camera.  I hope this problem does not continue.  Also I like having a temperature gauge on the monitor (even if they are usually off by a few degrees) and I found the startup sound quite annoying.Overall, I found this Samsung baby monitor to present an adequate picture, with acceptable audio and video noise.  The monitor looks great, but lacks important functions that are commonly found in monitors at this price range.  I would recommend the MBP33 over this monitor.

Reviews.Title: Freezes up, found my poor baby screaming and hyperventalating
Reviews.Author: Chrissie
Reviews.Content: I bought this 3 months ago.  A week ago I woke up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom and heard a wierd noise in the home, looked over at the monitor and my baby was fast asleep.  I investigated all around my home, and couldn't find anything.  It sounded like animals fighting.  I finally went over near my 6 month olds sons room and he was screaming.  He had been crying for who knows how long?!!!  He was sweaty and hypervenatlating.  I went back in my room, and the monitor showed him fast asleep.  Called Samsund and they won't help me, will only take it in for repairs.  Also, I asked for a consumer alert to be sent out for other parents....and nothing.  Don't buy.  Who knows what could happen.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy - not reliable
Reviews.Author: Philip Assouad
Reviews.Content: I generally am a fan of Samsung electronics so we purchased this monitor - not impressed.  9 times out of 10 it was "out of range" even it is was 10 feet from the base.  Also, it does not hold a charge, sometimes not even for 10 minutes... look elsewhere for a monitor and don't buy because of the brand like we did.

Reviews.Title: Great for a quiet baby
Reviews.Author: W. Paugh
Reviews.Content: Overall I'd recommend this product, especially if you have a baby that makes no noise when they wake up. It works great, but I encountered some quirks. First, if you leave a t.v on in the room the camera will get confused and switch back and forth from night to day settings, making it very hard to see. When we finally mounted the camera we made sure to put it where the light from the t.v wouldn't catch it. It was over a week before we mounted it, we didn't want to; we wanted an up close view because we like to see her breathing. So, our only option was to attempt to prop it up with a pillow, since it is only designed for a wall mount. When we gave in and mounted it, the only wall we could put it on to avoid light from the t.v was further than we wanted, but still serves its purpose since I can see her when she wakes up. The battery life isn't great either, so you have to remember to charge it if you wont be near an outlet while they are asleep.

Reviews.Title: At last - a quality baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Troy Babcock "Troy"
Reviews.Content: This is an early review, but it's rare that I'm this happy about a product.  So we've used the Summer Slim and Something-or-other baby video monitor for about 2.5 years.  We've replaced it three times (using an extended warranty that was $30 for 15 months).  We spent probably $300+ in equipment and replacements and warranties on that machine.  When it broke last week I was done with it.  I found this at a good price (under $200) and I know the quality of Samsung so I bought it.  The look, feel, and quality of this camera so far outshines the Summer product that there's no way I'd ever go back.  The monitor feels almost like a Gameboy or something close to it.  The little things like time display, signal strength, and appearance on the monitor make this device so much better.  The zoom is a neat tool but not useful for us now, and I love the two-way voice communication just because I can surprise my daughter with it.  Seriously - if you've suffered with the absence of quality baby video monitors like we have, and have been forced to get the Summer products with extended warranties from places like Babies R Us - don't do it any longer!  So happy Samsung has entered this market and made a product that's (so far) easily worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed!
Reviews.Author: rocket7001
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this baby monitor. The first thing I noticed is the attractive design.  It is simple and sleek. It is also very user friendly. It comes with a manual, but it is very easy to figure out how to use it on your own.The Samsung SEW-3036 is just the right size. It is sturdy without being bulky. It is lightweight and really easy to carry around. It is small enough to fit in my pocket, but not too small. The screen is 3.5 inches. You can zoom in up to 2x. I don't need to use the zoom very often as I found the screen to be the perfect size, but it's a nice feature to have. The night vision was really clear as well. I was surprised at how well I could see all the baby's movements in the dark.The picture quality is excellent at any zoom. The video and sound are very clear, too.  I didn't experience any feedback or static at all. You can hook the monitor up to a total of four cameras. The cameras are extremely easy to set up. It only takes a few seconds to hook up one of the cameras. This really makes things easier for me. I don't have to worry about making sure the baby monitor is in the same room as my baby. I just set the cameras up and carry one thing with me. It really sets my mind at ease to be able to see what's happening as well.This is a huge improvement over the audio monitors I'm used to. The audio monitors let you hear what's happening in the baby's room, but they don't let you do anything about it. The Samsung SEW-3036 has a two way talk feature so you can talk to your baby, too.The best feature is the Voice Activated Mode (VOX). If you turn it on, the video monitor turns off if your baby is not making any noise and automatically turns back on when your baby starts making sounds. This is extremely convenient and really helps the battery life.The battery life is excellent. The battery lasts about 4 hours with continuous display and about 6 hours with sleep mode (VOX). I was also impressed with the range of this monitor. It has a great range. It beeps when you are out of range, but that doesn't happen to me very often.Overall, I am very impressed. The Samsung SEW-3036 is well worth the price. It is high tech, but still easy to use. There are enough features to customize it, but not so many that you get overwhelmed. I would highly recommend this baby monitor to anyone.

Reviews.Title: it broke after 5 month use
Reviews.Author: zhou
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor 5 month ago. the volume do not work anymore. I didn't keep my box so I have no way to contact Samsung. amazon give me a number that no one will answer. I guess I will never buy any Samsung product ever again.

Reviews.Title: I tried to love this monitor
Reviews.Author: Emily Topham
Reviews.Content: It has a lot going for it....the video quality is great, I like the zoom function, it is easy to set up and I love the VOX mode.However, there are some severe issues.  The first is the device randomly saying it is out of range when it definitely is not.  A little annoying, but it always comes back on when the baby makes noise, so not a fatal flaw.  Then it started unpairing from the camera regularly - a pain in the neck because you have to go back into the baby's room to re-pair it with the camera.  Again, I liked the device enough to overlook this.  Finally, last night it just stopped transmitting sound altogether.  The screen is fully charged, volume all the way up and the colored lights on the side indicate that it is capturing sound, but not transmitting it.  I have only been using this monitor for 5 months and at the end of the day who cares how great the video quality is if it doesn't do the one basic thing that you need a baby monitor to do.  I am so disappointed.  Luckily Amazon is allowing me to return this device despite it being past the return period.  Unfortunately, I have to sleep in the guest room next to my baby's room until we can find a new monitor.  Just the kind of inconvenience new parents need.

Reviews.Title: Night Vision problem!
Reviews.Author: Beth Olson "Beth"
Reviews.Content: I really like Samsung products, but this just does not cut it! I read about the night vision problem on some models and hoped that I would receive a working camera. Well, I'm sad to say that I am having the night vision sensor problem that other reviewers have complained about. I am so disappointed that Samsung would even continue to sell units that are not working properly. Now, I'm left considering returning and buying the Motorola. Booo Samsung!

Reviews.Title: ok, but died a year later.
Reviews.Author: Meredith P.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my first baby just about a year ago thinking that I would like the color picture, and the night vision, but I primarily bought it for the 800ft signal distance.  It definitely did not work up to 800 ft or really even close to it. Maybe if I were with the baby in an open field it might come close, but the range is much more limited than its claim inside a house.I don't know if I got a lemon, but the camera part just died a year later. I am more than a little disappointed with how much this monitor costs.PROS:picture is clear (to a certain distance)the noise indicator light is a great feature to have if you want to have the volume down.easy to adjust the camera angle and the set up took 2 seconds.CONS:If the room is too dark (nightlight in my case) the screen toggles back and forth from day to night vision and blinks on the screen. It doesn't disturb the baby but can be very distracting on the monitor end.It broke a year laterThe range is not 800ft.The color you see if very limited in any situation where the room does not have bright light.

Reviews.Title: Definitely recommend over other brands
Reviews.Author: Boogaloo "Boogaloo"
Reviews.Content: We originally had the Summer Infant double camera (we have twins) & it started playing up after only 2 weeks. So we ordered this and the Motorola to try out. We loved this one - huge screen, worked great with more than one camera. AND its cheaper than both the other 2. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: A good review for anyone.
Reviews.Author: T. Jenkins
Reviews.Content: I am a 23 yr old man, with my first child(son).Most of the bad reviews were from "Out of Range" reading. You will get this when first setting it up and every once in a while. All you have to do is, press the small button the on camera, on the left side. Wait a few seconds and it will surely come right back.The talk to baby feature works great and doesn't sound like a robot.Night vision I think works well. with blankets or things in the crib it will be hard to determine how baby is positioned.Sound sensor and VOX option is great. Saves the video and battery, when no sound is detected the screen will turn off. Also has a sleep button for manual turn off for the screen while still having sound.Zoom is okay, I dont really use it because the wide range of camera. The zoom just makes the picture blurry and pixelated if you ask me.Picture overall is great in my opinion.**The "Out of Range" reading people complain about really isnt a big deal to me. I have gotten it, maybe 2 times in the past month. I never get it while it is on, only when first starting it or accidentally hitting the change camera button. **Yes, you can have up to 4 cameras on this monitor!!! So if you hit that on accident, cycle back to Camera 1. You may get Out Of Range reading, hit the sync button on your camera again and you'll be okay. I have a 1700 sq ft home and it works everywhere, even outside.-Cons: Battery life.Battery life doesnt last very long off the charger. Maybe 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: I am yet another customer with a blinking night vision baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Ian san
Reviews.Content: I wish some of these poor reviews were on here when I bought this camera.Like a few other fathers on here, I bought this waaaaay before our baby was due.  Now that we are about to use it, I find I have the same blinking problem during night vision mode, and I am unable to return this defective product even though I have never really used it.  For those of you who have not read another review yet, during night vision mode, the camera switches between night vision and normal camera every 3 or so seconds.  It makes it hard to see anything during the night since both the camera and your eyes are adjusting to a different setting.I would not recommend this camera for one reason and one reason only.....the unreliability of getting a monitor without this glitch.  It seems that this is a relatively common issue.  If it were not for this one issue, I think I might like this camera.BTW, this is hard for me to say as both my wife and I are Samsung fans!  We have 3 Samsung TVs, 1 PC Monitor, a Galaxy Note 2, a Galaxy S3, and 3 Samsung Blu-Ray players.  So for me to say I have found a sub-par Samsung product sucks!!!!!!here is a link to Samsung's page for this product in case it helps anyone attempting to resolve this same issue[...]

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Definitely good. I was searching for a baby monitor that has a dependable VOX feature and I was lucky to have found this one.

Reviews.Title: Family bought it for loves it
Reviews.Author: David Mccall "Reviewer@Large"
Reviews.Content: WAY better than the SEW-3030 that we have (never buy again).  We also got a SEW-3034 as a replacement for the 3030 that works just fine, but from what we have seen this 3036 is the real deal and the best of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: This product are better than expected. Great image, great sound! The coast is little high but the quality of product value!

Reviews.Title: Works as described
Reviews.Author: FWSTL
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery.  Easy set up and seems to work as described.  Brand new model so only time will tell how long it will work.  I bought it with the expectation that extra cameras will be available soon.  I will be disappointed if the cameras are not avialable.

Reviews.Title: Works Excellent
Reviews.Author: Principe "Kiki"
Reviews.Content: I love it, very clear image, good sound and zoom, battery life also good, up to 6 hrs. Excellent product

Reviews.Title: AWEFUL!!!!
Reviews.Author: Deidre Larey
Reviews.Content: After 1 week of having this monitor the parent unit would not detect the camera anymore.  I reset it, unplugged them and even in the same room it still said out of range.  Thankfully Amazon has a great return department because I have returned it and bought a different brand.

Reviews.Title: On Going Defect Renders Useless
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "debater7"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were super excited to get this baby monitor. Previously, we only had a basic model from IKEA and were a little envious of our relatives high end models. We were getting a little kick out of the fact that we would be the only ones in our family with a color monitor. Unfortunately, we fell victim to a defect in the SEW-3036WN that is common to the model: the light sensor causes the camera to switch between day and night mode constantly so that you cannot actually see your baby. The result is that the IKEA monitor we paid less than 10 bucks for is more practical.This problem is commonplace in reviewer forums. Our attempts to get a replacement were unsuccessful. We were instructed by Samsung support to do a factory reset, which we did. It solved nothing for us or other reviewers. We were told to mail it to Samsung for repair, but had to go through a separate week-long process to determine if we qualified. We didn't because, as a Vine reviewer, I don't have a receipt. Had we qualified and sent a receipt, then Samsung would have sent a shipping label approximately a week later, according to their rep. Afterwards, we would've gotten a replacement a week or two after that. I'm very glad we weren't relying on this thing for our twins due in a few weeks. Since I never got a replacement, I can only review the product I have, which does not work.Having used other monitors at my relatives' homes, I can tell you that this model would not have gotten 5 stars from me, even if it had worked, because it lacks features common to similarly priced monitors and exchanges them for features that are less useful. For example, there is no ability to move the camera remotely or even to zoom into a particular spot digitally. Also, the monitor only has 3 or 4 hours of battery time and does not come with a stand charger. The cameras must be plugged in and come with a fairly short cord. The cameras also lack a clip and so cannot be attached to a crib or Pack-N-Play directly. Additional cameras are very expensive (approx. 125 dollars each). In light of these issues, having a color monitor really doesn't provide much practical benefit.For the price, you can do better than this baby monitor, assuming it works, and there are strong odds that it will not. If you decide to go for it anyway, save the receipt and order well in advance of your due date because Samsung isn't going to do anything to help you quickly.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Baby Monitor with High Quality
Reviews.Author: Singdanny
Reviews.Content: I previously tried several types of baby monitors such as audio, video, andIP-based monitors, and I found out that a video baby monitor is the moststable type that does not have many flaws. IP-based one is constantly losingits signal and lag is unbearable. For audio monitor, you can only hear thesound of baby and cannot prevent any incident from happening. One time, myson fell down from his crib, but I didn't notice even though my audiomonitor was on. So, my last resort was choosing a video monitor that has allthe features with user friendly interface which is this SEW-3036.The SEW-3036 is not a full-feature video monitor (lack of pan and tiltfunction) but its simplicity wins over other monitors. I purchased this unitfor my newborn daughter, and my 9 years old son can use all the functions ofthis monitor without problem. This thing is really easy to use!! Simple menuand easy to navigate. The picture quality is great and not bright enough tohurt your eyes (other monitor was too bright to stare more than 5 min). Thenight vision is also clear enough to see my baby's movements in the night.Most of all, this monitor does not make constant beeping sound that drivesyou CRAZY (except out of range, that's the only beep). Nicely done withdesign and look. Not cheaply made plastic.Pros:Excellent Picture Quality (Clean & Calm Image,  Night Vision)Battery Saving (Almost last 4 hours with heavy use) - Voice Activated Mode(VOX) and Sleep ModeClear Sound with Minimized Howling or Static NoiseUser friendly interface with ease of useNo interference by wireless devicesExpandable up to 4 cameras (Switch Channels)Cons:No pan and tilt functionNo temperature sensorOverall, I highly recommend this monitor for those who tired with learningall the functions of "high-tech" baby monitor. To me, the baby monitorshould be focused on monitoring a baby not fancy features that annoy you.This monitor focused on quality of display and sound. If you are looking fora baby monitor that does its job, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great Baby Monitor and Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Sky
Reviews.Content: This Baby Monitor System by Samsung SEW-3036 I am happy to find is small and efficient. It comes with a camera and monitor and up to 3 more cameras can be added to this one system. The range is amazing so I can carry around the monitor in my hand, pocket, however I want. It's so light. And it will work for hundreds of feet away from the camera. The camera can be set up in a few seconds and can be configured to start at one and rotate to all of them for 10 seconds at a time if you have more than one which I find exciting-there is night vision too and if you have more than one camera each one can be set up any way you want, in seconds! Even with the one camera, the way it can be controlled it's pretty much all that's necessary but it's hard to believe all those things can be done with this system. It's so cool. It's high tech but easy to operate. It has 2 way speaking and the monitor is so cute it has a little stand and antenna. It has zoom too. There are lots of features in this little system that you really have to check out for yourself. It's fun. I really feel it's a great investment.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad one, all things considered.
Reviews.Author: A. Rivkin "AR"
Reviews.Content: I wrote a bad review at first because I apparently had a faulty unit. It kept losing sound and the video kept degenerating and going black. The company contacted me and sent me a replacement with an upgrade to the next model. I'm happy with the customer service.So I still think the voice activated system is too sensitive even on the lowest sensitivity setting, after a while it just picks up every tiny sound. The screen scratches super easily, so buy a screen guard like for a cell phone. The reason I chose this one is because motorola doesn't have VOX mode. I think VOX setting is crucial since no one wants to hear every whimper or sound machine in their baby room while they're trying to sleep. So even if you can turn the video part off on other machines, the sound is still heard. Since I have a sound machine in her room, that irritated me. VOX mode saves your baby from constant EMF radiation too. The camera only broadcasts the waves when it's activated by crying. I highly recommend it. On the other hand, this one doesn't have a temp reading. No idea why, since it's a great camera overall and their newest model. How hard is it to put a temp reading in it? But I think that's less important than VOX mode. The other thing that's a bit irritating is that a lot of features you have to go through the menu to get to, like zooming in on the baby. I also thing that they should have made the buttons light up so it's easier to navigate in the middle of the night. But that's asking for too much, right? I mean, it's 2013, we're just starting to have computers in the house. Soon every person will be able to have a laptop. (end sarcasm).Overall it's good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product with only two minor issues
Reviews.Author: Gustavo R.
Reviews.Content: Its a great camera. And a great image and sound you will receive. The receiver (image display) holds charge for at least 5 hours of using without pluging on the outlet if you use it constantly. On the sleep mode (which wakes when baby cries) it will last a lot longer.Theres only two issues.1 - Power up sound.Its an annoying music. And too loud for my taste. At least it is a quick one.2 - Blinking infrared (with a fix I found myself)The infrared is great. Excellent night vision.But it gets confused and starts blinking in every 3 seconds.Goes dark... 3 seconds... image... 3 seconds... goes dark again... 3 seconds. And that goes on.I found a solution for that just fixing a black tape over the sensor found bellow the power on/off swith. A round sensor (round glass).Doing that the camera became very stable.That sensor I read that sends accurate information for the infrared itself. So it "pings" some data over the room.As the room wall is clear yellow (almost white), that sensor did return the false reading... and made the camera blink.Just tape it and you will be alright. But remember: Dark tape. I did first use a white tape with no success.Besides that... a GREAT camera.

Reviews.Title: Night Vision Defect is The Final Straw
Reviews.Author: Doc Brown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were expecting our first when we ordered this last fall. When we got it, I tested its functionality.Several things stood out to me that I disliked from the beginning. When you turn the monitor on, a very loud melody plays with the Samsung logo on the screen. In my opinion, neither is needed. I can see the brand right on the plastic. The tone is loud enough to be on par with "passionate discussion" between two people, more than loud enough to disturb a sleeping baby. You better have the monitor already turned on or turn it on a few rooms away from the baby to keep the child asleep.Also, the lens on the camera doesn't allow a very wide field of view. If you want the whole crib in the picture, you will need to get fairly far away from it. Compound that with the very short power cable for the camera, and you are left with few if any options for camera placement in the room. We ended up going off of the front corner of the crib to a side wall six feet away. We got the entire crib in the picture at an awkward angle in the viewer, but it's manageable. The icing on this paragraph's criticisms is that the picture quality is bad for what you are paying. Jump ahead to after my child's birth and I cannot tell if her eyes are opened or closed despite looking right at them. I think I should be able to tell.With all of that said, I would have been okay with this product. However, when my child was born this winter, we got hit with the blinking night-vision defect out of nowhere. If you read other negative reviews, you already know about it. Essentially, the camera blinks from normal vision to night vision every three seconds when it should be in night vision all of the time because the room is dark: Dark -> Night Vision -> Dark -> Night Vision, over and over. Thinking that maybe the light sensor was picking something from the IR light, I did an experiment. In a dark room, I put four layers of DUCT TAPE on the sensor with no change. I then took a black shirt and wrapped the camera up in it, still blinks. My conclusions were that it once worked, broke, and now can no longer operate in a useful way in a dark room.With this glitch, I went to the internet to see what's up. Looking at other reviews, I see it's a common problem. I also do not see a public response from Samsung to my satisfaction. In a twist of irony, my wanting to be a good parent meant that I bought it months before, so refunds aren't possible now. As it stands, my time is more valuable than the money this thing costs, so we are keeping it with a workaround: door open and hallway light on. I don't plan on pursuing technical support because I am busy and we actually do need to use it, even in its limited state. However, I do hope to help others. Don't be fooled! This unit is crap. My opinion of Samsung has plummeted. I won't buy ANY of their products again.Finally, just to prove I am not a shill, I have no alternative products to offer in this review. All of these video monitors look like potential rip-offs to me. The only help I can provide is to say that THIS product is DEFINITELY a rip-off. Don't believe the positive reviews if you ever intend on using the night-vision feature.

Reviews.Title: It's only been 1 day....UPDATED4/12/13
Reviews.Author: JPD27
Reviews.Content: I just bought this monitor today at a local retailer.  I know it's rather premature for a real world review, but this monitor is soooooooo much better than our older monitor (http://www.amazon.com/Motorola-Digital-Video-Monitor-Screen/dp/B004VL2VS8/ref=sr_1_8?ie=UTF8&qid;=1360356505&sr;=8-8&keywords;=motorola+baby+monitors)That said, your experience may vary depending on what you currently have or have had in the past.  This Samsung  monitor offers better night vision ability, a wider field of vision from the included camera, and a much larger screen than our previous unit.  Everything is a vast improvement over the Motorola we have.  For some reason beyond on all logic they are priced the same on amazon... While the Motorola can be found for less on some sites, I have yet to see a price that is comparable to its value.  Ok, enough bashing on the Motorola, I just want you all to understand the comparison I have to work with.IP cameras?I have been looking for a few months now for a new monitor and have considered IP cameras as a possible solution.  It might be a solution, but the price combined with a lack of a dedicated monitor along with many technical problems made me weary.  Perhaps the more tech savvy folks can make that route work, but I didn't not think it was worth my time.Multiple cam setup?This Samsung baby monitor has the ability to add 3 more cameras which is great if you want to monitor multiple rooms or kids. Pairing the cameras is easy. The actual display is quite nice. It has a belt clip and a stand that swings out.  The stand makes the display sturdy, which was an issue with our previous monitor.  The camera's stand is also very sturdy and adjustments you make hold well.  The camera can be wall mounted as well with the included hardware.I will update this review with my continuing experience, but overall it's the best value.  The reviews are good and it's not so expensive.=========================================As promised I am updating this review.  This monitor is still working flawlessly.  In many other reviews I see complaints about the start-up sound-yeah, its annoying-but it lasts less than 3 seconds.  I have also read that this camera works poorly in low light.  That is absolutely false for me.  Based on other reviews, its safe to say there are some bad units.  Mine is not one of them.  I also have zero wifi interference issues.  I live in a condo building.  There are dozens of wifi signals and that includes mine.  No interference.  Ever.I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: It seriously blinks at night, battery life too short
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how it qualifies to get 5 stars when it blinks every 5 seconds at night losing the sight of the baby constantly. you cannot sleep with this monitor on. Also the battery life was too short, it's gotten pretty annoying. I had to return it and got a summer infant which does not blink and the battery lasts longer.

Reviews.Title: Very good product. I recommend it.
Reviews.Author: Bub Song
Reviews.Content: So far this baby monitor has been working flawlessly. Before I made this purchase, I read all the reviews on Amazon and decided to give a try. Let me address couple of issues that other reviewers pointed out. For wireless coverage, I do not find any interference due to router or any other devices. Currently, I'm using a wireless router that provided from Verizon (which is 802.11N) and has wireless bridge for TV and game consoles. Zero interference. But, I definitely agree that 800 ft coverage is not true. To me, it was about 100~140 ft range.

Reviews.Title: Boy have baby monitors come a long way.
Reviews.Author: Michael Countryman "mike the camera man"
Reviews.Content: Ok I received this baby monitor by Samsung and have been pleased so far. It was very easy to unpack and not wired down like fort Knox. I had it un boxed  and working in less than 5 minutes. You can also purchase additional cams if needed to view on one monitor so that was nice to know but not needed for me. I tested it out one my 5 year old daughter first since she can speak and tell me what she hears and she was able to hear every word I said to her when I pushed the talk button so it must be nice and clear. The video quality is quite nice and clear but i did notice it seems to change over to the black and white screen in slightly lower than average lighting but no big deal. I decided to test  the true real world range and feel way short of the 800 ft claimed. My house is 85 ft long so I had placed the camera at one end of the house and proceeded to walk to the other end and noticed 3/4 way through the walk that the signal would drop real low but if I stopped walking the signal would bounce right back to full. I was able to use it anywhere in my house and never lost signal so that is good. However I continued to walk outside and that was when it started getting not so good. I would say the total useable range of indoors outdoors combined for me was no more than 120 ft. Anymore it would lose signal and beep until I was motionless then it would work again. Max range without walking and this is with the camera indoors and me outside at 150 foot but that was it. I also found that you must have the antenna up while using it clipped to your side and that is not real comfortable and it feels like you may break the antenna off when you bend over or something. If you try to use it clipped to your side with the antenna down it just plain has no range at all. Overall I really like the VOX feature so you don't have the monitor screen on all the time and will only turn on when the baby makes noise. This also helps the battery last much longer when the monitor is not plugged into a power supply. All in all I would say it is a very nice usable system but don't expect to be able to use it at long range like it advertises.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor
Reviews.Author: Karen in Mommyland
Reviews.Content: This Samsung video monitor is our third experience with a video monitor.  When compared to two current monitors from The First Years, I'd say this one measures up to them pretty well.  The picture quality is good and you have the ability to zoom in a bit to get a better look at the baby.  The monitor also has the capability to be expanded up to four cameras.  I imagine this would allow you to have cameras in multiple rooms to check in on more than one child.The camera end of this monitor can be mounted on a wall or placed on a piece of furniture or a shelf to obtain the optimal angle.  Unlike the video monitors from The First Years, this one has a red light on the camera that is constant.  I actually prefer this red light to the irritating bright blue light on the The First Years monitors, especially since the light on those monitors will blink on and off in the baby's room if the parent unit is not turned on.A nice feature on this Samsung unit is you can talk to the baby through it.  The night vision feature is also nice to have.  Our baby sleeps in a completely dark room and it's nice to be able to get a peek at her using this monitor.  It's perfect for parents of babies who are super light sleepers.Now while I really do like this monitor, I have to say that I prefer non-video monitors.  I primarily use the Sony Baby Talk monitor for our daughter and I think the sound quality on that monitor is far better than any of the three video monitors we have.

Reviews.Title: My 2nd Video Monitor, Big Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Scott H. "Scott H."
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this Video Monitor last week to replace my MobiCam DXR that met it's demise for no apparent reason.  It just wouldn't power on any longer.  To be fair, Mobi is replacing it for free (great customer service) even tho it's outside of it's warranty, but I had to have something in the interim so I read the reviews and purchased the Samsung.  Needless to say, the Samsung is the device that will stay in my baby's nursery.First thing is the design.  The camera and the parent receiver are well designed and feel really well made.  A clear step up over the cheaper feeling DXR.  The screen on the parent monitor is also higher resolution and it is quite a bit clearer overall.  I couldn't really make out the eyes of my baby with the DXR, but I clearly can with the Samsung at about 5 feet away in both night and day modes.  That's not to say that either screen is all that good, they are both pretty bad, but I think that's just the product segment.  I haven't seen any video monitors that are really outstanding in this regard so finding something merely adequate is a good start.The buttons are pretty flush to the unit (especially the menu and sleep buttons) so it's hard to find them when being woken up from sleep in the middle of the night but that's just a minor complaint.  I'm sure with more use, it'll become second nature like it was with the DXR which had quite a few more buttons on the device in general.I also like how the Samsung has the lights on the side of the receiver so you can see noise levels without having to have the volume turned up or have the screen on at all.  I like to sleep with my device muted and the video off because I can hear when the baby gets to the point of crying for food, so with the device muted, I don't hear every little peep out of his room, thus waking me up.  The lights are good enough for a quick glance to see how much of a disturbance he is causing.  Haha.The rest of the features, I don't really use.  The VOX feature sounds cool, and it works great, but I just don't see a need for it at this time.  Maybe in the future.  Same thing with adding multiple cameras...maybe in the future when our baby starts playing outdoors or something.  Plus, I don't see where you can buy extra Samsung cameras anyway, so that'll probably come in the future.To recap, this device is significantly better than the MobiCam DXR that I used for four months before it met it's demise, so I'm happy with my purchase and I'll be recommending it to future mom's and dad's that are on the lookout for a new monitoring system.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Product
Reviews.Author: UBugMe
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my NEW grandson when he comes over to my house.  I was very impressed with the Samsung product.  I ordered it mainly because of the reviews.  I also have other Samsung products so I thought this would be a good buy.  I was correct.  The VOX feature is amazing. I still have to run up and down the stairs when I hear him, but at least I know what I'm running for! :-) Grandmothers ROCK!

Reviews.Title: Awesome video baby monitor at reasonable cost
Reviews.Author: Priya
Reviews.Content: I have a newborn baby and was looking for Samsung video baby monitor, as Samsung brand products are always my first choice. I just came across Samsung SEW-3036WN model and got impressed by its big screen and lovely design. I went through all the features and bought it. Now, I must say that I have made a right choice. Its video and sound qualities are amazing. I can clearly hear the sound of my baby from the second floor. The battery life is quite impressive. It lasts for more than 4 hours when it detects the sound continuously otherwise it goes on sleep mode and makes the battery life even longer. It comes back automatically if it hears the sound. This makes me quite relaxing. I can watch my baby while working. There is `Vox" system in the device that controls this feature and makes it pretty useful. It has number of another useful features. It has a scan mode and can be connected to multiple cameras. It will be beneficial when my baby starts playing and walking as I can fit more cameras in different rooms and play yard to keep watch on my baby's activities. There is no need to figure out in the device, as everything is so simple and user-friendly. Overall, it is really a useful device and price is also quite reasonable. You will not find such device with so many attractive features anywhere in the market at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Nick Tipper
Reviews.Content: This is great. It was recommended by a friend. The set up is very easy and the range is good. We have it in the baby room which is approximately 15 metres from the lounge where we watch TV at night. The battery lasts the night and the picture is very clear. What is especially nice is that the monitor has no problems giving a clear picture when it is placed in a dark room.This product gives us great freedom and allows us to keep a close eye on our son.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with product.
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Brezinski
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for my granddaughter who is a new mother, she researched baby monitors and chose this model.

Reviews.Title: ALWAYS OUT OF RANGE
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: This is the worst product I have ever purchased, I use it in a room that is 4 feet from the camera and it continuously says that it's out of range. I would never ever buy this again. The monitor makes a constant be saying it is out of range when I am literally less than 10 feet away from the camera. Do not ever ever ever buy this

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: James Edgar
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE PRODUCT!!! The range on the package is no where close to what it says it can do. It frequently goes "out-of-range" when you are well within range.The baby monitor stopped working after a few months and i sent it back to Samsung, as it was still under warranty.  When it was returned, it was not fixed.  Made a loud sound and when you try to contact them, you get no reply.DO NOT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: Out of Range
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: 3 days into the monitor and I get the following message - out of range..the monitor is right next to the camera. Lousy product. They should pay me for using it.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't match with other Samsung models.
Reviews.Author: kfrazier
Reviews.Content: The monitor does not match up with other very similar Samsung cameras. Our monitor charging plug went out and we thought this may be a great solution, then we would have two cameras and one monitor. Not the case. Cameras and monitors only work with the ones they were created with, not prior or later models. Even if they look the same and do exactly the same things. The only difference is the color of the plastic.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Tucker's Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this baby monitor because I wanted to be able to check in on my little one without going into her room or having to get out of bed in the middle of the night unnecessarily. The monitor works well during the day but at night the camera does not work well at all--it turns into an overpriced audio monitor; no matter how I adjust the brightness, we can't see ANYTHING but we can hear her. I really like the VOX setting but the monitor constantly displays an Out of Range error despite remaining stationary and well within the monitor range. Look for other alternatives- this is not a good monitor!

Reviews.Title: Returned it after 30 days
Reviews.Author: Mindy Heu
Reviews.Content: Purchased this from Target for our baby boy.  From the beginning it would not work properly because I'm out of range. Weird because the family room is directly below the baby's room and that's where I am usually.  After about 20 days the monitor started freezing up, one day it was completely out of range, and most recently the voice activation totally screwed up.  Without me pushing/holding onto the VOX button, it would stick to where my son could hear whatever I was saying/doing while he napped.  My husband and I couldn't figure out why his nap time cut from up to two hours to less than 20 minutes.  Then I went up to his room with the monitor and guess what, heard myself talking to my husband through the monitor.  Returned it immediately and purchased the Summer infant monitor for the same price, in addition the Summer infant monitor had a monitor controller.

Reviews.Title: Poor Signal
Reviews.Author: Andrew William Huddleston
Reviews.Content: This monitor is really nice besides the fact that the signal always cuts in and out if I am in the living room. If I am one room over or across the hall its fine but I go down the hall into the living room and signal cuts in and out constantly.Other than that the picture is nice and the night vision works well

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Nicholle DellaPietra
Reviews.Content: Receiver wouldn't work 10 feet from camera in a small single story home. We have wifi and no reception issues with phones, laptops or any other devices

Reviews.Title: An excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Adriana Naranjo
Reviews.Content: High quality color and sound, comfortable handling.  It is lightweight and really secure and interference free signal...I love it

Reviews.Title: Working perfect.
Reviews.Author: Breydys Tapia
Reviews.Content: I almost buy a different one, but after looking the reviews i changed my mind and it worth it. Excellent camera, but if you live on a house of cement your signal can be blocked.

Reviews.Title: Product has NO range
Reviews.Author: James E Gould
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on this one!  My child's room is upstairs, approx. 25 feet from where I use the monitor and it cannot get a strong signal no matter what I try.  The signal goes in and out and the overall quality of the unit is poor as well.  Avoid this one, seriously.  Have tried it for 6 weeks and cannot find any way to make it work at all.  Terrible.

Reviews.Title: Non Stop Blinking
Reviews.Author: Kaily Beatty
Reviews.Content: I really loved the picture quality... but it blinked from day to night vision every 5 or 10 seconds... too bad. I got the Motorola instead and have not had any issues.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Eric Gregg
Reviews.Content: Honestly, it's too late to return this and we will continue to use it but blech it's not good. The picture is terrible, most of the time you can only see something you assume to be a baby. And, it is regularly out of range even if I am just in the front room - and it's arbitrary because often it's in range and then the next day is out of range in the same location. Also, when you have to go sync it back up or is out of range it beeps loudly, so you cannot sneak into her room to do it - - is insanity. I would highly suggest looking to another monitor...

Reviews.Title: Great camera!  We love it!
Reviews.Author: S. Thomas
Reviews.Content: This camera does exactly what we need.  We can hear our daughter and see her very well.  We have blackout curtains in her room so the camera was choosing color over night vision during the day but the picture was hard to see on the monitor.  So, we put a sticker (you can also use a band-aid) over the sensor.  This forces is to go to night vision all the time.  We love that.  I love that you can mute it completely.  I love that you can talk to the baby.  I love that you can see the green dots turn to red when the volume of the child gets louder.  We never have to use the antenna because it gets great reception.  Easy to use and simple menus.  If you want more cameras you can pair multiple cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very good monitor
Reviews.Author: Princess "PrincessRah"
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to compare it to, but we love this monitor. It goes a very long range and it very user friendly. I feel comfortable being in another room.

Reviews.Title: Was very good until it stopped turning on
Reviews.Author: N. Park
Reviews.Content: I received the baby monitor as a gift before my daughter was born in February, 2012. The picture quality of the monitor is adequate and the night vision capabilities are extremely helpful when using while the baby is sleeping. There were a few times over the course of the year when the monitor no longer would sync properly with the camera but they were quickly resolved by pulling the power plug on the camera and putting it back in.After 11 months of usage though, the baby monitor stopped turning on. I contacted customer service to get the unit repaired under warranty but because I received the unit as a gift and the original purchaser had purchased it a little over a year before the unit broke down, they were unwilling to cover the unit.My advice is to look at other options for a baby monitor given the company's unwilling to stand behind a $180 product.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: We have a "man cave" which is a un attached building away from our house.  This thing reaches just fine out there and we are able to view our daughter sleeping while we whoop it up in the cave.  Great picture, charge life, everything.  Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Works fine but the battery is terrible.
Reviews.Author: Brandon Chuck
Reviews.Content: I picked up this camera because it had some pretty good reviews that I thought would justify the high cost.  It does work as advertised.  While it has pretty good reception and range, the main reason I bought this model was because it had a portable rechargeable monitor.  Unfortunately the battery in the monitor completely died in less than three months of use.  Now it has to be plugged in to work.  Making matters worse, when the monitor is unplugged for whatever reason,  it has to be re-synced with the camera because it loses all its settings due to the dead battery.  Three months of battery use is terrible, especially for the high cost of this unit.

Reviews.Title: The best one yet
Reviews.Author: Kelli
Reviews.Content: I have researched the crap out of these and finally purchased this one... We love it. The night vision is awesome and the quality of the picture is great. My son even loves it since he can hear us talk back to him. Everything about it great. The only thing is i wish the camera had the ability to rotate from the monitor. It does zoom though.

Reviews.Title: Must have for 1st time parent
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S Mayer
Reviews.Content: Used this product for 6 months now.  Love the night vision feature, can see the video pretty clearly.  The zoom is straight on and a little limited - not really useful unless its pointing DIRECTLY at what you want to zoom.  Didn't have any problems with interference with wireless network, etc. that other people complained of.  Every once and a while the sound will stop transmitting for some reason - can fix by turning the camera unit off and on again - kind of a pain when that happens.  Every once in a great while the camera will un-pair from the monitor and you have to re-do it.  Again, no real reason why, just happens.  Haven't figured out how to use the talk back function, will have to look that up in the manual at some point but haven't really needed it.  Overall it does what is supposed to 99% of the time.  Nice to have the video in addition to sound, especially as 1st time parent.

Reviews.Title: Great to monitor your loved one.
Reviews.Author: R1911H
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  I use it a lot to monitor someone who requires 24-7 care.  It allows me to work around the house and still maintain observation and communication.  It does not however live up to the advertised 800 foot range.  I tried this outside with direct line to line sight and the best I could get was about 400 feet.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: larissa linde
Reviews.Content: Monitor works great, sound and picture quality are good.  We use it all the time, great investment. We love it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung wireless baby monitor
Reviews.Author: allison h.
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I got the samsung baby monitor instead of the Motorola one. The picture at night is pretty good. It works great at home, but in my parents  condo, if the baby is in the back room and I am in the kitchen on the other side of the condo it is "out of range" ( I think its because the condo is on the beach has a lot of concrete).The main reason I love this one is because it can be muted. We had a couple of weeks of colic. I could turn the volume off and still see her and the light a went to read when she was screaming . If you need a 5 minute break from your sweet but colicky baby, but still want to make sure you baby is ok, you will want a video monitor that mutes... I've heard that the Motorola doesn't have this option.

Reviews.Title: Never reached 800'
Reviews.Author: Franck & Rachel
Reviews.Content: Fancy and nice product, but never reached 800' (not even close) as mentioned in the description. Go with a less expensive option...

Reviews.Title: Using it to watch over stroke survivor
Reviews.Author: S. Fischoff "and wife, Rachel"
Reviews.Content: My husband is bed-bound, a stroke survivor.  I can comfortably work in a another room andstill watch over him with this terrific product.  The range is better than I expected -- I can gooutside with it hooked to my hip and do my beloved gardening on our 2 1/2 acres.  The nightvision is good enough, the day picture is surprisingly clear.  The sound quality is excellent -I can hear him breathing !  (and snoring)

Reviews.Title: Not worth my time.
Reviews.Author: Josef Hejda
Reviews.Content: Rolled the dice and hoped I'd get a functioning model.The monitor randomly un-pairs from the camera, standby modes does not work, always in night vision mode.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the month at all!!!!
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Miller
Reviews.Content: Horrible, I cant tell you how upset I was when I received the product in covered dust box. Then set it up to find out the quality of the camera was horrible and the camera would turn off and on all on its own. Continued for three days like that had nothing to do with battery or anything I could fix...I returned the item. Not worth the money at all

Reviews.Title: Make sure you actually read the instructions
Reviews.Author: VitaminJ
Reviews.Content: Great baby monitor.  The video/audio are excellent (even in total darkness).  The range is satisfactory for even the largest homes we've stayed at.  I have not observed any interference with my wifi router or cordless phone.  This baby monitor does not connect to the internet, so you don't have to worry about hackers looking at your kid.One minor complaint: the white text on the buttons rubs off fairly easily.Important: Make sure you learn about the "Pairing" button on the camera.  Otherwise, you'll spend a great deal of time staring at a blank screen and wondering how your baby is doing.

Reviews.Title: sometimes goes "out of range"
Reviews.Author: kim
Reviews.Content: Just received it in the mail yesterday - works pretty well so far! I like the clear picture, sound, and features. The only issue I've had is it seems to go "out of range" at times, but that may be related to our other baby monitor we have in use.

Reviews.Title: Range is not good
Reviews.Author: Kortney Stanton
Reviews.Content: We bought this because it claims the range is up to 800ft.  Well it lost signal as soon as I got to the side of my garage (detached in rear of house) probably no further than 75 feet from the camera.  So we took it back to target and bought the $130 motorola video monitor.  The motorola was able to keep work all the way to the back lot line of my backyard which is about 225 feet from the baby's room.  If range is important to you and you want to be in the back yard while the baby is sleeping in the house then skip this samsung one for sure.

Reviews.Title: Works great, easy
Reviews.Author: jaxxnjas
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my stepson and he says it was easy to set up and the screen is nice and clear.

Reviews.Title: GREAT monitor, people shouldn't be so harsh on it!
Reviews.Author: genevievex "Genevieve"
Reviews.Content: Totally wonderful baby monitor.  Color is awesome in day light.  Black and white at night.  Faded color with window coverings closed during the day.  Don't expect HD 1080 crystal clear miracles here, people.  It does its job in a superior way and that's what matters.  You can hear every single move baby makes, breathing/little grunts and cries and you can see it all very clearly.PROS:- clear view of baby on large screen- clear sound- nice that you can talk to your baby or other person in the room with baby from monitor- monitor has an easel to stand it up on your desk/counter- plug it into the wall and never worry about batteries OR...- you can take it outside when you water the garden and know your baby is doing fineCONS:cannot complain!  works too well!

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made for price paid
Reviews.Author: South_County_Girl
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit disappointed with this monitor. You can barely move around the camera to see different angles/corners of the crib and the picture quality is very grainy. Seems cheaply made for the price you spend on it. In addition, every time I turn it on, I have to synch the camera so it's detected by the monitor which is annoying. If we have a second baby, I will look for a different monitor. This one works so I will use it, but I don't love it.

Reviews.Title: great choice with clear images!
Reviews.Author: jon tuten
Reviews.Content: I researched baby monitors for weeks and finally settled on this one. I can honestly say I love it! It has a very clear picture and I love the option to zoom in to monitor the baby's breathing patterns. The monitor is big and the camera is easily adjustable for any type of mounting or moving. The only downfall has been the camera at random times. I have had to turn it off a couple of times to get it to work again. Luckily the company said they will send me a new one if this problem continues. I highly recommend this product and might be adding an additional camera to this monitor for our next bundle:)

Reviews.Title: Terrible product and horrible customer service from Samsung
Reviews.Author: Cahumiko
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the monitor goes "out of range" when it is clearly within range, randomly and for no apparent reason. It also interferes with wifi. But I could have dealt with all that if the product didn't just completely stop working after 3 months of normal use. The sound still works faintly but the screen only projects white. It happened once before and we were able to reset it, but now it won't resume function no matter what we do. We bought it a few months before our daughter was born so it's too late to utilize the Amazon return policy. Samsung's phone tree is almost comically horrible, and I was redirected through no fewer than 5 departments before someone was willing to speak to me. He directed us to fill out a product repair form online, which we had already done only to discover that Amazon's invoice is not sufficient proof of purchase for Samsung to prove that the product was purchased within the timeframe of the warranty.  Without a standard store receipt they would only repair the product for a $45 fee, which is insane after a $180 product breaks after 3 months.  Our other option was to send them a copy of our daughter's birth certificate, also insane. I will never buy another product from Samsung. Don't waste your money on this baby monitor. A good old fashioned audio-only model would be more reliable and less expensive than this paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Best baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I received this product probably 2-3 days after I ordered it. The volume on it is great, with no interference, and the picture quality is nice. I also love the kick stand in the back. It is easy to use. I didn't even look at the manual.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Easy
Reviews.Author: JOHN C LYNN
Reviews.Content: Received this Camera and it was an easy setup, lets me know when he's making noise or rolling over without  staringat receiver. Also allows for additional cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor!
Reviews.Author: Jason M Danz
