Reviews.Content: Love this monitor...except when it is on night vision, the screen will blank out every 5-10secs.  I guess it is refocusing or something.  Otherwise works well.

Reviews.Title: Thought it was a good idea...
Reviews.Author: Steve Overby
Reviews.Content: ******UPDATE******This is an update to my original post. After I wrote this review I was contacted by the company that sells this Samsung product. They were disappointed to hear that I purchased a product from them that I was not happy with. They offered to exchange the monitor free of charge. They sent a new monitor right to our door within a few days. We then packaged up the old malfunctioning unit and sent it back, no shipping charges to us required. The tune still plays when I turn it on, that can not be helped and maybe with the next monitor Samsung creates they will leave this annoying feature off. I find that the video and sound is clear. Do not expect HD TV quality picture from a monitor, you will not find one. The daytime picture is fine. I can see my baby, eyes closed or open and what is going on. The night vision is just what I expect it to be. It's night vision people, it is not intended to be the best quality picture you could have. You will not see certain colors on the black and white picture, but you will get the idea of what baby is up to. This feature is for checking on your little one to see if they need you in the middle of the night, and it allows me to do just that. I am no longer having the OUT OF RANGE reading when walking around my home either. Overall, I think the Monitor functions just as I need it to and I am happy for the most part with this.*****ORIGINAL POST*****Like so many other reviewers, I did my homework before purchasing this monitor. I have other Samsung products and have been nothing but happy with them. Unfortunately I am not a fan of this monitor. The night vision blinks in and out and I have called support about this issue. They told me that the room must be pitch black in order for the night vision to work. I assured them that the room was completely black. He then told me that it was possibly a manufacturing defect and unfortunately he could not help me with that issue. I would have to first contact Amazon for a return and then if they couldn't help I could call back so they could put in for a service request for the video portion of the unit. He gave me nothing but a run around and in the end didn't help the issue. The tune that the monitor plays is extremely loud with no way to turn it down or mute this. I have to hold the monitor against me to try and muffle the noise. I often get an "out of range" signal when I am across my home (about 40 feet, just a bathroom between the monitors.) No other electronics or signal disrupters between the units.The audio is clear and the day video is clear. Disappointed in this product.

Reviews.Title: Horrible audio quality
Reviews.Author: SM&A;
Reviews.Content: We are looking to replace a 4 yr old Summer monitor that has become a bit crackly. We ordered this and a Lorex. Both are going back due to horrible audio quality. Both have the speaker on the back of the monitor, and the ridiculously flimsy kickstands on both units are useless. The sound has to be turned all the way up to have any hope of hearing the baby before they become so upset they are screaming, but with the volume up that high, there is an annoying hissing noise instead. With our old Summer monitor, we can easily hear or child's every breath, if we choose to. Isn't that the point of a monitor?

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: M Allen
Reviews.Content: I bought this as we are caring for my Grandma in our home. She is on the main floor and our bedroom is upstairs. This is perfect for our needs. I can hear her and talk to her without making a trip downstairs. Sometimes she is just making noise in her sleep and I can see that her eyes are closed and she doesn't need me. It saves me a lot of trips downstairs in the middle of the night. Also, she can tell me if she needs something and I am able to tell her I am coming. Love those features!

Reviews.Title: Buy more cameras...
Reviews.Author: Mommy Mo "Mo"
Reviews.Content: It works great. It's not as clear as the box indicates, but you have no problem seeing your baby. Definitely invest in more cameras if your baby sleeps in different areas of your home. We constantly have to unplug the camera and move it from room to room. It would be good to have a camera already set up. Also, but battery life on the monitor doesn't last that long.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Myra D.
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice product. Very easy to set up and use. Both day and night vision quality is really good. Picks up on any sound my little one makes. Definitely recommend this for a new parent.

Reviews.Title: Broken in 2 Months
Reviews.Author: Tamara
Reviews.Content: We're not sure why but for some reason this monitor completely stopped working after only 2 months. No matter where we put it or plug it in, it just says, "Out of Range". Very disappointing. This was not a cheap monitor and we're very disappointed. We have a webcam for our other child that works great and has never let us down. Thats the way to go for all you parents out there.

Reviews.Title: Defective Unit But Excellent Customer Service
Reviews.Author: SoCalStacy
Reviews.Content: The short of it:  The monitor ceased working 3 months into use, but Soltech Customer Service was so outstanding that they apologized, arranged to replace the monitor with a newer model for free, and paid for return shipping of the older, defective model so that it can be examined.Now the details:I did so much research before purchasing this monitor--even bought and returned two others, including the Infant Optics DXR-5 2.4 GHz Digital Video Baby Monitor with Night Vision from Amazon--and thought I'd finally found the perfect one.  Unfortunately, I was disappointed.First, the picture resolution of the SEW-3036WN is not outstanding.  It's better than the cheap video monitors, but it's far from clear.  The publicity pic depicts an image on the monitor that suggests the clarity at least of a close-up photo taken on a smartphone.  This is misleading.  The actual picture display is grainier and small features are indistinct.  It's better than the Infant Optics display, but not great.  I have perfect vision, and I could never tell if my baby's eyes were open.Second, the sound failed within 3 months of having used the monitor.  Our monitor remained in a corner of our kitchen counter, far removed from stove, sink, or anything else that could have damaged it.  It was never dropped or abused.  Nonetheless, about 3 months after we started using it, the sound became fuzzy and indistinct.  Two days later, it died completely.  Now we have a silent video monitor.  Useless!  I bought the monitor in January but didn't install it until early June.  The sound failed in August.  That's pretty darn pathetic.Almost forgot to mention:  that annoying blacking-out during night-vision operation that other buyers have mentioned?  Happened to us, too--frequently.On the plus side, the 2-way mic is awesome; it's great being able to talk directly through the mic to the kids upstairs and then hear them respond.  Also, the plastic housing of the camera and receiver is of good quality.  More like the smooth, solid material of a cell phone than the flimsy plastic of most baby monitors.  Also, the receiver can accommodate up to four cameras, so you can have multiple angles or different rooms under surveillance.  But just how useful is a durable exterior when the critical inner parts have died?After speaking with the merchant, Soltech U.S., I learned that these problems have surfaced in the older batches of this monitor (mine apparently came from one of them).  The representative also assured me, however, that the merchant has raised the issues with the manufacturer, and that they have been addressed so that the newer batches of the monitor should be fine.I am currently waiting on the replacement model, which the merchant was cool enough to send out right away.  I'll update the review 3 months after using that one.

Reviews.Title: Love this monitor
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Aschebrook
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have purchased this sooner! My little guy has trouble sleeping and even though he'd still be asleep, he often "sleep cries" which before we had this monitor, we'd end up having to check in on him for no reason. This usually woke him up and meant that we'd be in there for a while trying to rub his back and get him to settle back down. With this monitor, the night vision is really crisp and clear - I can see if my child is crying because he's trying to roll over, if he's stuck, if something isn't right, etc. I can see clearly if he needs to sort of fuss it out or if he needs me without actually going in (which normally wakes him up completely once one of us goes in to the room). The range on it is really nice, too. I am able to take the parent unit outside while I get some yard work done and still be able to see in to the room. My other favorite feature is the VOX setting which allows the monitor to be ON but the display turned off until there's noise detected and it turns on. Really helpful for saving battery life.Overall, this monitor really does a great job, I am quite happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Quit working after six weeks
Reviews.Author: Fishguy1368
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this product initially but the camera totally quit working after six weeks. I do appreciate the full refund from Amazon though. My replacement order was for a Motorola unit.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working But Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: La Crosse, WI
Reviews.Content: Updated: Although our monitor stopped working, I got great customer service from Soltech.  They called me shortly after I posted my review.  They have sent me a new one right away.  I have updated to three stars on my review due to great customer service.This monitor seemed to be great at first.  But It has stopped working after only 10 months.  The monitor has stopped being able to be charged.  And since the return window has passed, I am now stuck with a monitor that I paid $180 for and does not work.

Reviews.Title: Buy it silly parent!!!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: It's pretty good, I didn't have much expectation for it but to show me a clear picture and have sound. It's the picture quality as nice as my iPhone? No, but it's still nice, and I can add more cameras for different angle that I could change to easily with the hand device. It's priced just right I think.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Amy Moak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to monitor my new Granddaughter while she sleeps.  I am very pleased with the quality of the display and the sound.  Don't know how I raised my children without a video monitor. I have had the monitor for a month or so and am well pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: C. Ciancutti
Reviews.Content: We've generally been very happy with this monitor.Best - you can mute the monitor and see the sound volume with the green/red lights on the left side of the screen. This is great for our house, where we can easily hear him through doors/walls, and the stereo effect of having sound on the monitor is unpleasant. Crazily, not every monitor can be muted!Worst - battery life is terrible. We can get through one nap on a battery charge, but by the time for the next nap, it needs to be plugged in. So in practice I leave it plugged in almost all the time. This is a pain when we have babysitters because I have to unplug the charging cable next to my bed and move it into the living room.The video quality is good - we keep the nursery dark so it's nearly always in infrared mode, and we can easily see if our baby is asleep or awake or moving/standing/etc. I will note for other reviewers that if you turn the brightness down on the monitor, you get a much better infrared picture.The menu is straightforward, and controls are pretty intuitive. We don't use the talk-through-the-camera feature, but I can see how it could be handy later.

Reviews.Title: Best Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C. Mccarty "Ken"
Reviews.Content: Better than expectedThe technology is improving every 6 monthsFantastic night visionAudio is clear and two way talking is great

Reviews.Title: incessant beeping, awful range
Reviews.Author: matthew_woodget
Reviews.Content: We are *done* with this. Not only does it have terrible range, contrary to its marketing claims, when it loses signal it beeps. And it is fickle. This can result in you thinking you have found a spot it works in only to be woken at 3am by its beeping. Let me reiterate that; you are a parent of a baby, you are frequently awoken in the middle of the night due to this privilege. Then your baby monitor wakes you even when the child is sleeping. One of the only reasons you have this is to make monitoring your baby easier and less disruptive. It doesn't need to beep and there is no way to disable the beeping. It claims 800 (?) ft range. It doesn't work through 80ft of standard house. Our final gripe is the cords, well done Samsung bean counters you saved a few bucks, and your poor product needs an extension cable to go anywhere apart from a dresser. With its terrible range you will want to put it up high, you will need an extension cable. We will be returning this failure of a product.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend.
Reviews.Author: John P. Schlosser
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed by this monitor. While the reception is fine, it has some serious flaws:-Night vision doesn't work well. It has to be absolutely dark for it to stay on, otherwise it constantly switches from night vision to normal mode, where you can't really see anything. Useless.-The kick-stand is very flimsy and folds away too easily. So when I wake up in the middle of the night to check what's going on, eyes half-open and groggy, I grab the monitor and accidentally fold in the kick-stand, causing it to fall and make noise, and requiring me to use both hands to fold it back out again. Not good when its 2AM and you want to go back to sleep ASAP.-The monitor makes this horrible tune when you turn it on. Sort of like Samsung's theme song or whatever. When my wife is already asleep and I turn the thing on, I have to put it between my pillows to muffle the noise or else I'll wake up my wife.-The belt holster is too thin. Forget about putting it on a man's belt; it will not fit. Jean pocket is the best is can do.I would stick to the Motorola competitor of this thing if I were you.

Reviews.Title: Poor and intermittent reception
Reviews.Author: Mason Cabot
Reviews.Content: *** Update ***+1 star for customer service. The vendor got in touch with me after reading this review and offered a full refund on the product, even though it was well past the return policy. I packed up the defective monitor and sent it back, a few days later the refund was in my hands. The vendor was easy to work with and clearly understands the value of happy customers--I would do business with them again.**************My wife and I have been using this monitor for about 4 months and are not pleased with its performance.Our biggest gripe is reception--this barely works from across our small two bedroom house (50 yards front to back). I could forgive this and write the troubles off as house interference (from walls, wires, other wireless device interference, etc), but we have now taken our baby on a few trips and the Samsung monitor doesn't perform in any conditions. Urban, suburban, rural, camping, whatever, the reception is poor and doesn't go further than 30-40 yards in any environment.Don't buy this monitor. It only works when you are within earshot. Doesn't that defeat the purpose of a baby monitor?

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend this product
Reviews.Author: Frankie
Reviews.Content: This monitor was so easy to set up and the video was excellant. I did not buy this for a baby, I bought it for my 85yr old mother-in-law. She had a stroke 3 yrs ago and I quit a job to care for her. She wants to be home, not a nursing home. I am a RN and lives next door but lately I've been concern for her safety, because I need to come home at night and sleep in my bed. This is the perfect help I needed. It picks up from her bedroom to mine, even though she has plaster walls. JOKE- If I see her trying to get out of bed, I can push a button and say  "Momma, get back in the Bed" ha ha. I should have bought this a long time ago.I may purchase one for my Border Collie when I leave her in the house during bad weather.

Reviews.Title: Night vision only worked for two months
Reviews.Author: Emily Sanderson
Reviews.Content: This product worked fine for a couple months, however the night vision began to cut out after a month and then stopped working. I bought this product because I thought Samsung was a trustworthy brand. $180 later I found out that I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: Good except for one thing
Reviews.Author: Ms. W
Reviews.Content: This is a great monitor.  The sound and picture quality during the day and night are fantastic.  The only problem is that if you turn it off or change a setting- it gives the "out of range" notice and beeps.  You have to go back to the monitor and reset everything (turn on and off) right next to each other in order for it to work again.  Sometimes it happens at the most inconvenient moments...

Reviews.Title: Not 800 ft
Reviews.Author: Dorthea Puckett
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly this long range camera did not reach any further then my Summer camera that is for 200 ft. The night quality is also very poor in comparison to my Summer

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Clvogt
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd monitor we've bought. We decided to go with a trusted electronics brand, rather than a baby product brand, this time. We really like it! The picture is great and we like the big screen.Our favorite feature is the VOX mode where the monitor basically goes to sleep when the room is quiet but turns back on when there is any noise. This helps me sleep better knowing it will light up when our guy is waking up.The downfall to it is that the battery life is terrible. We fully charged it before its first use but still quickly lost it's charge. Now I just make sure it's charging before I go to bed because I'm afraid the battery will die during the night and I won't hear the baby.Overall, we would recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: NAKIA C JOHNSON
Reviews.Content: I have used this baby Monitor and was very happy with it, the picture is very clear if night or day. I am also happy with the range of the monitor to the cam, we used to have the baby sleep on the second floor while we were able to watch and hear him from downstairs.I would recommend this monitor!

Reviews.Title: Just what mom needed
Reviews.Author: G Egizi
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a monitor for my daughter and found the reviews here on Amazon to be berry helpful. So based on those reviews I purchased this monitor. My daughter reports that the quality is excellent and she can have more piece of mind. She even spotted the cat in the room and was able to remove him. Great video and audio

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!
Reviews.Author: Caroline Sung
Reviews.Content: I just moved in with my boyfriend with my first child so I was very excited to use my first baby monitor. After an extensive research, we decided to go with Samsung because of its high review rating and our dependable history with Samsung products. I have been using this for a week now and it has been great! I have no trouble with range and audio as some 1 star reviewers mentioned. Night vision works great and the VOX feature proved to be very useful. Awesome product!

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended monitor!!
Reviews.Author: jman
Reviews.Content: I used to have to run up and down the halls just to make sure something hadn’t happened in the baby’s room at night. Sometimes I’d also have to run up the stairs while making dinner to make sure everything was ok. I bought this monitor and finally have some peace of mind while doing my daily routine around the house. Since it is wireless, I can just carry the monitor around with me around the house. The night vision quality is great for when I’m trying to sleep. I’ve purchased 2 additional cameras that connect very easily to the monitor so that I can keep tabs on the baby whether he’s in the living room, his room, or crawling around our room.

Reviews.Title: Failed in under 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: LFP
Reviews.Content: New Review 12/31/13:I returned this product because the display unit entirely failed in under 2 weeks. It was never dropped, dinged, or scratched - it just sat on a table. Maybe I got a dud.Very disappointed given that this is a Samsung product and not budget priced. I replaced it with a unit that cost approx $140 labelled "Babies R Us" that has a 5" screen with good resolution and excellent night vision.------------------------Original Review:The product arrived promptly and was well packaged. Setup took a matter of seconds. Image quality is about what I'd expect, and the 3.5" display is elegant and seems to work well. Night vision is good and the microphone is well attenuated. Range is excellent even though it runs on the 2.4 Ghz spectrum and there are a very large number of wireless devices sharing that piece of spectrum.

Reviews.Title: Great!! Love my baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: Albert Kang
Reviews.Content: This is a great baby monitor set... Really easy to use and work out of box. I had a zero problem with setting it up and vox feature works great. Only downside of this monitor is starting up sound. Other than that, it works like charm. Also planning to add more cameras with this unit. Will recommend to parents who desperately need a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Terrible reception
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We used this for one night and returned it since it did not work for us. The monitor has terrible reception.

Reviews.Title: Expensive dysfunctional monitor
Reviews.Author: L. Driggers
Reviews.Content: I registered for this monitor because it had pretty good reviews and appeared to be a great high-end monitor, but after family spent so much money on it, I was extremely disappointed.  Let me detail the many ways it has disappointed:1.  It makes our wireless internet speed 0.002 mgb/sec or something.  I actually didn't realize what was going on until I was on the phone with our internet company and it hit me.  As soon as I turned the monitor off, the speed jumped up to normal.  Ridiculous.  So unless you're looking for a way to keep yourself off the internet while the baby's asleep...2.  It makes a VERY loud and stupid jingle when it turns on.  You cannot turn off this feature.  So don't turn the monitor on before you leave the baby's room or you're liable to have an awake baby once more.3. The night vision function is dysfunctional.  It flicks back and forth between normal and night vision every 3 seconds when there is low light - even when it's pitch black.  Which means every 3 seconds you can't see anything at all.4. And worst of all - and this may be just mine, but 3 times now, the sound has completely stopped working.  The worst time this happened, I had the monitor on the VOX function (which is a great function actually).  Usually, our son wakes me up with his whimpers and grunts, then he eats and easily goes back to sleep.  But when I started back at work, we moved him to his own room so that I could sleep easier. The monitor was supposed to make it so we could still keep an ear out for him at night when he was waking up to eat (versus just breathing loudly enough to wake me up when he was in our room).  But when the sound stopped functioning, I woke up to an inconsolable baby because he had to scream for so long to get my attention.  I felt horrible!5. When I contacted Samsung about these issues, they ignored me.  When I emailed them a second time a few weeks later, but angrier, they finally answered.  But they told me to ask the person who gave it to me for a receipt!  Are you kidding??  I registered for an expensive monitor, friends were kind enough to buy it, and now I'm going to ask them for a receipt so I can return it??  That seems rude to me.  Luckily, Amazon did not ask me to be so rude and they are taking this defective piece of crap back.  I will find another monitor that isn't dysfunctional and poorly designed.

Reviews.Title: Works great, battery life is eccellent
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: I wanted super high quality, portability, long battery life, and a large screen.  This monitor is the best available product to meet those specs.  We love this monitor, it really is portable and the battery lasts plenty long (I think it might be 8 hours, but I never need to use it that long so I just plug it in when done), we left the house with it on the counter unplugged for half a day and it was still on and around 50% when we returned.  Screen resolution is adequate, the portability is the best feature.My wife can take it out in the garden while baby is sleeping (brick house), i can take it into the garage and putter while baby sleeps.  We can carry it all over the house while doing chores.  The range is about 75 feet through a brick wall (antenna down), inside our (~2000 sf) 2 story home it works everywhere including the basement with the antenna down.Another nicety is that the manual is brief and to the point, each icon is explained in about a 2 page spread.Improvement Suggestion #1The switch from color to B&W; (Infrared) seems to be set for a higher light level than I would have chosen, there is a significant decrease in image quality in infrared mode (as is the case with all camera's), but I think the threshold is to early resulting in an unnecessary loss in quality in evening or low light.  An option to change the LUX where this occurs would be a nice touch.Improvement Suggestion #2The belt clip doesn't have much "bite", it cant handle thicker belts, or thicker pants.  A belt holster accessory would be a lot better, similar to those for a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Very Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Lindsey Anderson
Reviews.Content: We have used this monitor consistently for 4 months. The night vision is great, not the BEST resolution, but it gets the job done. Our bedroom is on the opposite side of the house and never loses signal. Also a major fan of the VOX function.My only gripes are the power on sound, which is loud and unnecessary, and the crappy battery life. We keep ours charging in our room all night and the nanny uses it unplugged during the day for nap times and the battery is almost always dead by the time we are home from work. Still overall a great monitor. Love Samsung screens :)

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Rocky
Reviews.Content: After using the monitors for a few weeks I had some issues with them. They went out of range a lot, and were a little glitchy. I also don't like that there is no low battery warning tone. I did think the picture quality was pretty good and the sound quality is very good, I like that I can talk to my son through them. Some people complained about the kickstand being flimsy, I think it is adequate and I love that it has one! I like that it is small and light weight. I noticed some people posted that the night vision goes in and out sometimes, I had an issue with this at first but realized that the curtain in the bedroom was open slightly and the light was hitting the camera, once I closed the curtain I didn't have that problem anymore. I ended up sending this one back and getting the SEW-3037W model through the company since I was having some issues. So far I'm pretty happy with that model but it's only been 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice that I made. Go for it!
Reviews.Author: Zoe Santrini
Reviews.Content: My first baby monitor purchase and so far so good. I have been using it for 2 weeks now and having this unit around is quite convenient. I fully charged it for 10 hours and the handheld unit lasts around 5-6 hours which is more than acceptable. The picture quality is quite good and not so bright that it hurt my eyes. Very calm imaging, if you ask me. I definitely recommend this unit to other parents as well. Try it. You will definitely like it.

Reviews.Title: Not that good.
Reviews.Author: Juan G.
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this baby monitor to provide more quality video. Either in day light or IR vision, quality is quite poor. Another issue is with battery duration, it cant hold for a full night w/o plugin the cord.There are good features though, havent had issues with range or disconections and sound sensor is great!!

Reviews.Title: Babt Monitor Samsung
Reviews.Author: DougAssis76
Reviews.Content: Perfect!! This baby monitor have an amazing image quality. Day and Night Vision is perfect. Sound Perfect. Me and My Wife love it!

Reviews.Title: Great monitor with necessary features. Highly Recommended!
Reviews.Author: PrincessJanny
Reviews.Content: Like all other gadgets, too many features will give you a headache and force you to spend much time to figure out how to operate it. I tried several baby monitors that have `fancy' features like using Internet connection (constant drop signal, interfered by other devices), pan and tilt, and so on. In my opinion, you should stick with a simple baby monitor that you can fully operate it without hassles. That is the reason why I choose this Samsung baby monitor. Not complicated and simple. Works for me!

Reviews.Title: Best monitor I've tried
Reviews.Author: Caroline Rossy
Reviews.Content: This is the third video monitor we have used. The first was a Motorola, which some friends recommended, but it conked out on us in just 4 months (and we hadn't dropped it or been too rough, the sound just stopped working). We then tried Baby Optics, which has mostly rave reviews, but frankly seems cheaply made and has no features and a tiny screen. I returned it and decided to go for Samsung. Every Samsung product I have had has been very good and reliable and this one seems no different. It's nicely made, easy to set up and has good features (like to the two way talk button and sleep mode button to turn the screen on and off). And the screen is a nice size and has a much clearer picture than the other monitors I have used. Don't be fooled by the number of reviews that the Baby Optics or Motorola have received, this Samsung is definitely worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Really happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Christina Clarke
Reviews.Content: Video quality is great, intercom feature is what sold me! Not sure how I survived with just an audio monitor for my first two kids ;)

Reviews.Title: don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: britt 0514
Reviews.Content: I thought Samsung would be the better brand rather than Summer. Wrong! Camera quality is horrible, night vision is really bad andcamera goes out of range. Sometimes the camera would go out of range even in the next room. I didn't trust it to go to sleep. I would have to reset the night vision because the camera would flash on and off every 3 seconds. It was like sleeping with a strobe light. To reset tge monitor I had to go into the babies room and try not to wake her up to fix the out og range or flashing. Very annoying!! But what's even more annoying is the loud start up song it plays everytime you turn it on. I returned this as soon as I could. I purchased http://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B004B762AK/ref=redir_mdp_mobile. Summer touch color is about the same price and way better!! It has so many more features that parents need. Please research before buying!

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: Very easy, very practical. I Install and start to use. The night camera its very good. I recommend to all of you!

Reviews.Title: Price was Right!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn S. McGlothlin
Reviews.Content: This monitor has worked great for us so far.  It was the same price as the comparable Motorola monitor that everyone has, but a larger screen size.  When I saw that, I was sold.  Easy to set up, easy to use.  Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: Karin "chinese crested mom"
Reviews.Content: the best on the market. the best sound and image. the fact that you can also add additional cameras is good also. love it.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in picture quality. Returned it and am using Summer Infant Best View system now. Summer has better picture and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Expensive, but worth it
Reviews.Author: KGS
Reviews.Content: Works very well.  About the only feature it does not have is the ability to speak to your infant remotely or start playing a lullaby remotely.  I'm not sure if we would have ever utilized that much.  Other than that, this is a very nice device.

Reviews.Title: Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Debbie I.
Reviews.Content: This Samsung video monitor was just what I was looking for. The monitor is not big and bulky like some others. The screen is a good size. The fact that sound is both ways (speaking and listening) is a really nice feature. Overall, a big improvement from my old video monitor.

Reviews.Title: Good for what you pay for
Reviews.Author: B. Lawton "Gamer"
Reviews.Content: My 2 year old is very very quiet. I never truly knew when he was asleep unless I went in and looked at him so got this so I could monitor his sleeping. I do like the two way communication feature at first I thought it wouldnt matter but it's nice that when he does in that rare moment cry just being able to tell him that it is ok and to lay back down is enough for him to settle down. I do wish I could pan it from the remote I thought you could but it only lets you pan when it is zoomed in but if you have it mounted high enough to see the whole cribe it's not really a big deal. Picture is a little grainey at night but you can still see if his eyes are open or not so dont really care about that. I only gave it 4 since you cant pan and the battery doesnt last all night unless plugged in. I forgot to plug it in and had it on vox but was still dead in the morning and if it beeped to warn me that it was dieing I never heard it. Thankfully like usual he was just quietly playing with his pillow pet when I woke up and realized he was up before me so no harm done just make sure its always plugged in when you go to bed.

Reviews.Title: Overall good video monitor
Reviews.Author: Bernhard M Zimmermann
Reviews.Content: This is our first video monitor, overall we are very happy with it.  No problems with reception throughout our house, and I'm not experiencing any WiFi interference so far.  The picture is okay, I didn't expect HD quality but was hoping for a bit better picture than what we are getting.  Since I have not looked at other video monitors, the picture quality may be comparable to other systems.Overall pleased with this purchase and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product Great Value
Reviews.Author: M & T
Reviews.Content: I've had the Samsung Video Baby Monitor for about a month now. I really love this product. The video quality is great, it has excellent wifi range (even in an old plaster house), and is very easy to use.I would highly recommend purchasing this product.

Reviews.Title: Like it a lot, but the picture quality isn't perfect
Reviews.Author: MegsMom
Reviews.Content: This is a great monitor - amazing how far technology has come since just three years ago when we had our first. Unfortunately the picture quality is a bit grainy at night. We can absolutely still see our child, but it feels like they could have stepped up that feature a bit.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Samantha Bermudez "Samster"
Reviews.Content: After months and months searching for a monitor that is well worth it I decided to give this one a try. I not only think the presentation looks great but it is also a great product. I was even happy that I ordered it through amazon and got a 1 year warranty for free.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: sheila carideo
Reviews.Content: I love this monitor . .I tried two other brands before, but this one exceeded my expectations.It is comforting to see my baby and I like the zoom function

Reviews.Title: Great monitor and great customer service
Reviews.Author: Caroline Langley
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this monitor from day one. After using it for 4 weeks it wouldn't display an image on my camera. I immediately emailed the seller and received a phone call from them a few short hours later. The nice lady helped me fix the camera problem and it now works perfectly. I honestly did not expect to hear back from them let alone get a phone call. This is GREAT customer service and I will continue to buy from this company!!!

Reviews.Title: Initial reflections
Reviews.Author: Carissa M Bowersox
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this monitor after reading and watching several reviews on multiple websites. Our baby is not here yet, but we have played around with this monitor the past few days. It was important to me that the monitor work, and work well, while I am outdoors periodically in the summer in my vegetable garden. The garden is about 200 feet from the baby's room, and the video works just fine. The audio does cut in and out, but the video remains.  I am a little concerned that the video will not be clear in the glaring summer sun, though. Another concern was with the WiFi interference we had read about. We are not having any problems with that at all, and we have multiple computer systems set up in our home. So far, looks like it will be a nice device.

Reviews.Title: great monitor
Reviews.Author: ashley
Reviews.Content: This is a good product. I love the screen size, easy to quickly see through the night. It has good sound quality. The only problem I had was the sound stopped working after 1 month of use. However, I contacted the company and they offered to send me a replacement at no charge to me. I am very satisfied with their service.

Reviews.Title: This will be my last baby monitor.
Reviews.Author: Jason Landau
Reviews.Content: I have 5 children.  You can imagine how crazy it can get around the house, and with 5 baby showers and welcoming parties I’ve pretty much had and tried all the latest baby related gadgets/devices including baby monitors.  Honestly, I never really believed in baby monitors because they never work well and I always end up sleeping with the newborn.  That was true until I received this Samsung SEW-3036 model.  This one doesn’t have as many accessory features as some of the other baby monitors, however it has been working out very well for me.  It stays connected all the time, does not disconnect / unpair randomly, and picture/sound quality is very clear.  This is the only baby monitor that I actually use and it will very well be the last one.

Reviews.Title: Good product, Great service.
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: My mother in law bought this monitor for me and my son.  I had accidently reset the monitor with the camera and had to re-pair the camera with the monitor.  Never been good with machines in general, I was having trouble and called the seller (Soltech) for support and they were fantastic.  They were patient with me in guiding me each step, and they didn’t rush me or anything the entire time on the phone.  They waited patiently until I had my monitor paired with the camera and made sure that every setup was the same as it was before.  I know Samsung makes good products, but I believe it’s the support and service that makes a product a well deserving 5 star.  Soltech certainly provided that service, which is the reason why I gave it the rating that I gave.

Reviews.Title: Very good monitor
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Davoli
Reviews.Content: We've only had the monitor for about a week--but we are happy with it in comparison to our former Samsung monitor which cost at least $50 more than this one. The sound accurate, but less acute (who wants to hear there own baby crying in a piercing pitch!), the image is clearer than our former monitor, and some of the control options seem more fluid than the earlier model we had.One thing that could be improved is on booting up the parent unit, a short melody goes off and it's very loud. No one wants anything loud on a baby monitor when the point is to get your baby sleeping! Also, we are yet to see, but our former Samsung model we replaced bc where the power cord meets the parent unit, seems to have worn to a point where when you plug it in, it actually won't charge--so it seems the link there in the electronic piece wore down. We hope this won't happen with this one--but we also hope to not unplug it from the parent unit camera as often. Lesson learned.One other bonus is that we qualified for a year or two warranty on this camera which is critical when you run into problems--had we had a warranty on our former monitor, we would not have needed to buy this one!

Reviews.Title: Great Baby shower gift!
Reviews.Author: YUNHEE KIM
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my sister’s baby shower, and she loved it! I got a chance to use it as well while babysitting my nephew, and picture quality is great during both day/night, and so is the range coverage.  Good quality product all around, just as what I’d expect from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor!
Reviews.Author: Young Jae Lee
Reviews.Content: I love this monitor because it doesn’t distract you with all the bells and whistles of unneeded features and the feature that you actually use and need works well.  No it doesn’t have temperature sensor and no you cannot connect this baby monitor to watch on a TV, but come on people, it’s a baby monitor.  It gets the monitoring job done very well, which means it’s a well-designed and clear focused piece of equipment.  It’s been a very good and reliable monitoring device, allowing me to view my son in his crib and play room from anywhere in the house.  It displays picture and transmits audio clearly with no interruptions and I cannot imagine how I had lived without this thing. I highly recommend this product to any parent who wants a simple, easy to use, and well working baby monitoring device.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Brieanne Bode
Reviews.Content: We ordered this monitor & had some trouble with it in the beginning. We received excellent customer service via phone however and all of the problems were taken care of!

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: E. Lindsey
Reviews.Content: We had some issues with this monitor - we weren't totally happy about the VOX setting, and then it stopped working. But I'm changing my review to 5 Stars because of the amazing customer service we have received from Jae at Soltech Security - the seller of the monitor. Jae has called me and worked with me to get me a new monitor for free. We would absolutely buy this product again because 1. it's a great product - picture is clear and sound is great and 2. The amazing customer service at Soltech.

Reviews.Title: Great quality.
Reviews.Author: Amanda L. Marello
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I love I can watch my son sleep and know he is safe. It has a neat feature where the screen shuts off if there is no sound and then it flips on when he starts making noise.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor so far
Reviews.Author: R. Awbrey "cbandico"
Reviews.Content: This monitor has been great so far to see our 3 month old.  It was very easy to install and the video quality is good. The battery life seems average.Pros-easy to usesetup is easygood video qualitygood night visiongood sound qualitysize of the screenIt can use up to 4 cameras I believe (we only have 1 set up)Cons-Whenever you turn the monitor on it it has a few very loud notes so you don't want to turn it on around the sleeping baby (even when volume is on silent)Only 2 zoom settings, not too clear the closer you zoom inYou can't move the camera while watching the babyI would recommend this product to other new parents.I wish that when the baby starting crying or making noise that the screen would automatically come out of the sleep mode instead of having to hit the sleep button to see the screen, however, it is fairly easy to pull this up.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Mushky
Reviews.Content: Really happy with the monitor but especially impressed with customer service. I had a problem and they sent me a new one right away. I never wrote a review before but they really deserve 5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung for the win!
Reviews.Author: Tarra
Reviews.Content: Samsung is one of my favorite companies and they have never let me down in the past. I have their TV, smartphone (galaxy s3), camera, and now a baby monitor. I like how the picture is crisp and I get to talk to my baby as well as hearing them. The battery life could be better but it looks like battery life is an issue for all baby monitors. Plus it’s not that bad with the VOX feature. I believe Samsung did a great job building this one and would purchase another one if I have another child. Maybe by that time, there will be even something better! (5 stars)

Reviews.Title: Clearing up some trivial issue
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: The purpose of this review is to share with everyone that the start up “jingle” is not as bad as people say it is. Other than that I actually really like the monitor so do not let just that decide on your purchase. Happy shopping.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars!
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: Throughout my trial and errors with baby monitors, I would have to say most of them resulted in an error. As I was having my third child, I was determined to find a good one this time. I would have to admit that I didn’t do a lot of homework purchasing the previous two so I made sure I did for my recent one. I decided to go with the Samsung Sew-3036 because the rating was pretty high on Amazon. Some people said they enjoyed the picture quality as well as night vision. The style, user friendly, and the simplicity were also praised upon. After using it for couple weeks, I agree with the reviewers and don’t really have anything bad to say except to thank the reviewers for helping me find this baby monitor!

Reviews.Title: Finally a monitor that works!
Reviews.Author: hwiwoon Lee
Reviews.Content: I’ve used baby monitors made by other brand, and I’ve been constantly disappointed.  Most had interference issues, and the range was certainly not far enough or kept disconnecting.  Although I was skeptical at first for another baby monitor, I desperately needed a monitor for my new born and decided to give Samsung a try.  And what do you know, this one actually works well!  No interference issue what so ever, and range is more than I could ask for.  My house is not a mansion, but the distance between the baby room and master bedroom is pretty far as these 2 rooms are on opposite sides of the house.  With all the walls and furniture in between, I haven’t had any issue.  What I regret most now is not having bought a Samsung baby monitor in the first place with my two previous ones, which I’m sure would’ve lasted a lot longer than the ones I actually used.  Out of all the different baby monitors out there, if you haven’t tried other brand, don’t even bother and just stick with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor, but annoying sound when you turn it on...
Reviews.Author: Farang
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I had to return the monitor. I could not get over the loud sound it had when turning it on. The picture quality was great tho...And I like that it had a clock too. I purchased a V-Tech now. too early to review it, but the picture quality is not as good as the samsung. But it will do to monitor a baby. It doesn't have a clock, but it has a temperature monitor. It seems like it's very hard to have all the features in one brand.I really like everything about the monitor so far, EXCEPT this really annoying sound it makes when you turn it on. I called samsung to see if there is any way to turn it off and there isn't...otherwise I like it!

Reviews.Title: Love everything but..
Reviews.Author: cswils
Reviews.Content: This is a great monitor. The picture and sound are nice and clear. It was also easy to set up. The only thing is sometimes after it has been on all night, when I press the sleep button to bring the screen up, the sound will be on but the screen will be black. It has only happened a few times but it is a little annoying nonetheless.I contacted Amazon and they were quick with their response. Based on their suggestion I contacted Samsung and their customer service was mediocre at best. They were friendly enough, but they just didn't really help me. After being transferred four times and given a wrong number once I was finally told to go to a website, fill out a repair form, and send the monitor in. I'm not going to send it in because then I will be out of a monitor who knows how long, but I did expect more from a worldwide company.Overall, I would still recommend this monitor because aside from the occasional black screen the monitor works really well.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: C. Park
Reviews.Content: First of all, i'm beggining to really like the Samsung brand.  I have multiple electronic devices/equipments and haven't had any problem with them.  ok, so the setup was quick simple and quick, i was up and running in about 30 minutes. The quality of video transfer onto the screen is pretty good.  I know other reviewers complained about the quality, but this isn't HDTV.  I like the two-wya feature. The zoom feature really degrades the quality of video, so i wouldn't use it. I like it overall, great job Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Does the job!
Reviews.Author: Jodi M.
Reviews.Content: I like that the Voice Activated feature allows the video monitor to stay on for a minute or so to determine whether or not you need to rush in to the nursery. Another I purchased and returned (Levana) didn't do this and I didn't like it.I also really like that the camera part not only moves up and down but it also turns side to side.  The picture quality is decent during the night and better during the day.  I like all the features on it including the digital clock.  Other reviews have mentioned that it has an annoying start up chime.....it does have this but it lasts for like 2 seconds and doesn't bother me at all. That's not a deal breaker for me at all.

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: laborx5
Reviews.Content: i am very pleased with this product. we bought this to aide in caring for an alzheimer's patient. we had purchased another unit, different brand, & had to return it due to poor color & picture quality. great video quality & zoom feature.

Reviews.Title: Audio is great! Good Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Nate Peterson
Reviews.Content: We initially were impressed by the audio and Vox features but felt the picture could be a little better.  We returned this and ordered the model just above this. SEW-3037 and found it to be much better.  Customer service reached out and offered an extended warrantee since I was unhappy with my initial purchase. Great customer service and I couldn't be happier with the SEW-3037. I took one star away just for the picture.  Which isn't horrible; just hoped it was a little better.

Reviews.Title: Nice device.
Reviews.Author: William Powell
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up. Delivers on the features advertised. A little pricey. I bought this for my new grandson so I didn't mind spending a little extra.

Reviews.Title: Good video baby monitor.
Reviews.Author: Bearcat
Reviews.Content: We have had several baby monitors including two that were video monitors prior to this.  The most recent one was a motorola which went bad after less than six months.  So far this samsung has performed great.  The camera is small and easy to place and the hand held unit is not to large and obtrusive like other I have seen.  The 3.5 inch screen is nice and shows good detail in both direct light and night vision mode.  The zoom is pretty nice but really we don't use it that much.  If there is something we feel like we have to zoom in on to see then we are probably going up to investigate in person anyway.  Overall it is a solid video/audio baby monitor and works as expected.  Would be nice to have a motorized camera but that would be a lot more money.

Reviews.Title: SO far the best one I have bought
Reviews.Author: Texas 11
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th video baby monitor. We have had two of the older version Summer's with the chunky video screen. Both stopped working properly with volume control after a year or so. The third was the Infant Optics. I wanted to love this monitor and the price was affordable. We could never get the monitor working with our wireless system, which meant we had to simply turn it off to go online or stream on the x-box. My husband is very computer literate and even with the costumer support it was not possible. So Frustrating!!!Samsung worked right out of the box. I did need to read the instructions, it being new to me. Camera is good night vision, even at a few feet away. Speaker is adjustable, so you don't shout at your kiddo and freak them out. The obvious is you don't want to place it ON your laptop or TV while using the internet. But I can have it in plain sight in near proximity with no issues. Great for us! Just takes some adjusting to figure out what you want your settings to be. I don't like the Voice Recognition turn on mode. It wakes me up when it is silent then turns on. Volume has great range compared to Infant Optics. Will buy a 2nd camera for my other kiddo.

Reviews.Title: GREAT !!!
Reviews.Author: LWhite
Reviews.Content: My son and daughter-in-law are having their first child in April, my first grandchild !!  She did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews before picking this baby monitor as the one they wanted.  I must say it is perfect and fits what they wanted.  And it is Samsung so you can't go wrong with it.  Great picture and sound !!

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised, but beware the rise of the machines.
Reviews.Author: Claire N.
Reviews.Content: This works as advertised.  I can see my daughter at night, although not with much clarity.  It is easy to use and was a breeze to set up. The controls are intuitive enough. I have it all the way across the room and mostly can tell if she is lying down, sitting up, or wandering around her room.  I suspect it would be a clearer image if it was closer to her, but the intent we had with it was to see what she was up to when she got out of bed.  We used a sound only monitor until moving her to a bed she could get out of on her own.All was going well and then one night we tried using the "talk" feature to speak to her and it FREAKED HER OUT.  She was indifferent to the baby monitor the first several weeks we had it, but now we have to coach her through it being "friendly" and we had to promise that it would NEVER EVER TALK AGAIN.  She distrusted it and made us cover it up and "put it to bed" with a blanket (we still used it for the sound).  Putting eye and smiley face stickers on it (that she chose) has made it less scary and now it looks like the camera part is a huge nose, which is kind of cute.  I suspect it will be several weeks before we no longer have to have conversations about the thing every night before bed, but she has once again started going to sleep without a blanket over it.So, it works, but you might want to be careful on how you introduce that feature.  It certainly was NOT the "say something to soothe your baby back to sleep" experience we were hoping it would be. We got something like an hour or more of total freak out followed by days and days of conversations about the monitor and how it is not scary.  My child is accustomed to some other talking toys and has spoken to both of us over the phone, so we figured this would be received a little more like the phone (which was really exciting for her)... but perhaps it is just too much to deal with alone in the dark.  The sound quality is also really a bit funky, so it sounds like a really creepy rendition of mom/dad instead of just sounding like them the way the phone does.  She also doesn't talk on the phone unless one of us is there holding it, so that might be some of it as well.

Reviews.Title: A Lot of problems with this product
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I bought this camara on January and  have some problems with it, the company replaced it with a newer model! I thought it will be different and better, So u bought a second camara for the newer model and now six months later the sound  on both camaras does not work! I can see my babies but I cannot hear them , so don't buy this product

Reviews.Title: Great product & Great seller
Reviews.Author: Miroslav Muras
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the product is exactly as advertised.  The product is worth the money. It has good voice and image quality.

Reviews.Title: Good picture and sound. Reliable
Reviews.Author: Vidivici
Reviews.Content: The picture is clear both in daylight and night in the dark. Sound is clear and two way talk is helpful when our other kids go to check on the baby and we can talk to them to do something to help.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor!
Reviews.Author: Regina Gaffney
Reviews.Content: This was worth every penny. Very user friendly, gets great range in our house and in our yard, visibility is great. We've had it for a little over a month and have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great Video and Sound quality
Reviews.Author: Rabih El Sherif
Reviews.Content: excellent video quality and big screen with good resolution even in the dark, very clear even small details can be seen.sound is great with the VOX option, you can sleep and the screen will light directly when detecting any sound from your baby.NB: zoom option is very nice.

Reviews.Title: Best baby monitor available
Reviews.Author: Judy Ward
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing!  I love the fact that you can also communicate with your child without leaving your bed.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: J. Shreve "Shrevil"
Reviews.Content: Can see well in the dark, monitor is up to date looking and quite functional.  Screen looks really good compaired to others i have seen.

Reviews.Title: Very useful for sleep training
Reviews.Author: nicone
Reviews.Content: We originally had an audio baby monitor but got this video baby monitor when we decided to do sleep training with our 4 month old. The IR image is clear and adequately bright. There is some interference with microwaves and wireless network gear but as long as you don't stand so close to these devices, the monitor will get back in range. The voice-activation feature (VOX) is useful in that it automatically turns on the screen when the baby makes a sound. This saves battery life and It is faster than having to fumble for the SLEEP button in the middle of the night. However, VOX is sensitive to any peep that your baby makes, so it will turn on (and most likely wake you up) when your baby may be just tossing and turning a bit in the crib. The screen automatically turns off after ~30 seconds. Overall, a very good product.

Reviews.Title: hook it up and you are ready to go
Reviews.Author: N. Glenn "Glenn."
Reviews.Content: The monitor has crystal reception. The picture is clear, and while the zoom is a general function , its useful for those 'is he REALLY' asleep moments.  The audio is also great, both to and from the camera.  The ability to add up to three more cameras means I can keep an eye on all the kids, which gives me peace of mind. The only 'con' I can think of is that the battery life is only a few hours unless you remember to use the :'sleep mode' which makes the image movement activated and the audio voice activated . However, its plenty for naptime and I just plug it in at night. Overall a great product totally. Worth the cost. The signal never has interference and I've never wondered if it was working properly. It comes auto-programmed so you just plug it in, set up the camera, and go.

Reviews.Title: excellent baby monitor with great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Daniel Drown
Reviews.Content: Normally I don't write reviews for products unless I am really satisfied with them. This baby monitor meets all of our needs and we have never had any wireless issues like interference. Its useful to see your baby as opposed to hearing since you can immediately see what if anything is wrong. I would buy this again in a heartbeat and recommend it without any hesitation. :-)

Reviews.Title: Samsung SEW-3036WN
Reviews.Author: C. Fore
Reviews.Content: Great purchase, really love being able to watch our son at night sleeping, or not sleeping in his room at night.  Much better sound quality than the normal wireless room monitors.  The Vox functionality is perfect function when you're trying to get sleep at night, and don't want the monitor to be constantly on.  Others mentioned an annoying vibrating feature, but I haven't had any such issues with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: masweis
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what we were looking for! The resolution on the screen is great and sound quality is superb!

Reviews.Title: great monitor
Reviews.Author: chelle
Reviews.Content: After getting a Babies r us monitor for my new baby girl and not being impressed, I looked at my friends Samsung monitor and decided to purchase it. It is a great monitor. It has good day vision, good night vision, nice screen, good sound. I am thinking about buying a second monitor for my sons room.

Reviews.Title: Super monitor
Reviews.Author: Lesli L
Reviews.Content: This is a great monitor...clear sound, terrific picture, great stability, and easy to use.  It is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Wanderson
Reviews.Content: Baby monitor excellent for use in the home or will for gift. Very good! I liked very much, I am satisfied and I recommend to all those who have babies.

Reviews.Title: A very satisfied Customer!
Reviews.Author: Electronicsaj
Reviews.Content: SEW-3036 is a beautiful monitor! Best I’ve seen! I’m having so much fun with this monitor. I love the simple look, nothing to bright and tacky… but still very warm and subtle. It’s a great looking monitor and camera. I also love the two-way-talk feature. It’s a lot of fun and it’s great that I can adjust the volume on the camera itself from my parent unit.   The resolution is great and the audio is also really clear. They say it will go up to 800ft in open space, I don’t think I wanna bother testing that out but I haven’t had any issues with the range.  It’s really a beautiful monitor.  It has a lot of helpful features. It hasn’t failed me yet. And, it’s at a reasonable price! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great so far!
Reviews.Author: Reader09 "Reader09"
Reviews.Content: I had a Summer Infant video monitor that I loved, but it stopped working.  I had bought it used, so I didn't even try to get the company to replace it.  I did extensive reviews of the various video monitors out there, and I determined that the Samsung had all the features I liked, and from what I could tell from the reviews, would be more durable than the Summer monitor.  I read a few negatives on the review for this one that I'd like to address.1. It doesn't mess with our wireless internet.  Some people complained about it slowing down their network.  My husband and I both work from home on the internet, so we would know if our network was slow, and it's not.2. Out-of-range not an issue.  We have a 2 story house with a basement, ~3400 sq ft.  My son sleeps in the top corner of the house, and we watch movies in the basement, and it's still in range.  Haven't tested it outside, but it works everywhere in the house, so that's good enough for me.3.  The little diddy it plays when you turn on the receiver is very annoying.  And, it plays at full volume even if you had the volume set low when you turned it off.  However, I don't really see a need to turn it on when I'm anywhere near my baby.  If I'm near my baby, I don't really need a monitor, do I? So yes, it is loud enough to wake a sleeping child, but there's no need to turn it on near a sleeping child.4. Some people complained about the placement of the buttons.  I don't personally find this to be an issue.  There aren't that many buttons, and it doesn't take long to learn where they are.  I'm only using it with one camera, so perhaps it would be annoying to have to go through the steps to switch cameras if I were monitoring 2 babies.  I'll have to come back and review once I have 2 babies.5. Some people complained of problems switching from day vision to night vision.  Samsung said their monitors were defective, and I think they must have been b/c I haven't had any issues with that.6. Don't know about the durability yet.  If it breaks, I'll come back on and reply to this review.Hope this helps!  Overall, I think it's a great monitor for the price, and I will feel like I've gotten my money's worth if it lasts a few years.

Reviews.Title: Excellent features, expandable for multiple children
Reviews.Author: LL Doll
Reviews.Content: I am a mother of two and this is my second video monitor. I had a Levana model previously that finally bit the dust and I was in need of a video monitor that could handle multiple cameras.Major positives and perks to this monitor include: - The audio can be muted while still viewing the video - It has a VOX feature: the video and audio are shut off after 1 minute if there is no sound detected. (This feature is an absolute must! It allows you to sleep at night without a bright screen on or white noise from the audio portion but you are alerted if you are needed. I will never ever own a monitor without this feature) - Video and audio quality are excellent - Talk feature is handy especially with a toddler when you want to let them know you are coming to get them or tell them to settle down and go to sleep. - It was incredibly easy to pair additional cameras and you can easily go from camera to camera or have it in scan mode where it will automatically switch between cameras every ten seconds. - It has a zoom feature that I will probably never use but it is there if you care about it.The only negatives I can say are: - It is a pricey system especially when you add additional cameras at $99 each. - The screen brightness doesn't dim much so when it comes on at night when in VOX mode it really lights up the room. - A Samsung jingle plays when you turn it on. (a minor irritation)All in all I am thrilled with the whole system and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect! Best baby monitor I've found yet... and we've had 5 of them!
Reviews.Author: Sparky Jones
Reviews.Content: This is my 3 or 4th review of baby monitors.  However, don't bother reading those as this one beats them hands down.  I just wish Samsung would have come out with it sooner.Pros:*  Clear and SECURE digital sound... no neighbors listening.*  Clear digital video, even when zoomed in. (Camera is 640x480 pixels)*  Auto infrared LED lights gives a great picture, even in larger rooms.*  Can add multiple cameras to one monitor and you can have it automatically cycle through them or just stay on one.*  Camera stand is sturdy and holds the camera in place once you get it set, so the camera doesn't move when sliding the switch off or on.*  Two way talk (I don't use this feature much.  My daughter thought it was an animal outside at first.)*  Again, the signal!  I got over 75ft away through five walls and didn't lose one bar of signal strength.*  Digital clock.*  Monitor screen can be turned off (sleep mode) while the microphone and speaker continue to function normally.*  Tone lets you know if the camera connection is dropped.  Great for those parents on the 'safer' side.  :o)Cons:*  Stupid start up melody is loud and can't be turned off.  Who thought this would be a good idea on a BABY MONITOR???*  Flip out stand that allows it to stand vertical is a little flimsy, but it works.Overall, the reception and video clarity of this monitor has been the best one we've used.  The fact you can add more cameras is really cool.  If Samsung would take that start up melody off and stiffen up the stand, this WOULD be perfect.  I still give it 5 stars though.  It's that good.Edit:  Typo

Reviews.Title: Fan of their VOX feature
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I made this review to talk about one of the SEW-3036's useful feature. That feature is the VOX feature. I first saw it the product video on their website as I have done my homework on baby monitor before my purchase. The man in the video described the VOX feature as auto sleep and auto wake function which saves a lot of battery life. That sounded pretty cool so I decided to purchase the Samsung SEW-3036 baby monitor.When I received my baby monitor, I was pleased that installation and usage was very simple. All you need to do is go to menu and go to pairing and press the button on the camera and it pairs within seconds. So to talk about the VOX feature, how it works is that the monitor will go into sleep mode if it does not detect any noise in the baby room for 60 seconds. It will wake up automatically if the baby starts to make noise. This is a very smart and useful feature as it eliminates background noise such as a fan in the baby room. Also, it saves a lot of battery so I do not have to charge very often like the many other baby monitors.One other thing I want to mention is howling. A lot of baby monitors produce howling, a high pitch noise caused when the parent unit and the camera gets too close, but the SEW-3036 produces minimum howling which I appreciate very much. It only produces howling if it gets really close about a foot. This is not bad at all compared to other baby monitors.Overall great baby monitor so do not hesitate to buy if you are in need of a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: fast and easy set up, but several problems - like wi-fi interference
Reviews.Author: Silea
Reviews.Content: First things first: this monitor operates at 2.4GHz, which can interfere with 802.11g or single-band 802.11n routers. If you have such a router, don't get this baby monitor unless you need some way to stop yourself from going online while your baby sleeps.Beyond that, this monitor is really easy to use. It comes all set up such that you can plug it in and go. No set-up required. The picture quality is pretty good, and the sound quality is on par with the audio-only baby monitor i had already.There are some serious problems, though.First off, when you turn on the parent unit (the one with the screen), it plays a little tune. I've found no way to turn that off. Even when the device is muted so i can't hear any sounds from the baby, the darn thing still wants to play me a song when i turn it on. Likewise, if it can't detect the camera, it helpfully beeps at you to let you know. There is no way to disable this audio alert.Second, the camera is basically designed to be wall-mounted. I wanted to set mine up on a dresser near the crib, but the crib mattress is at a much lower level. I can't tilt the camera down enough to get a good angle. If i wanted to screw it into the wall above the crib, it would have good range of motion, but i don't.Third, of course, is that i can only use this device if i want to block all wi-fi in my house. I could go buy a new router to get around this problem, but that's a bit silly.So if you don't use wi-fi for your internet, or have a router other than the type i mentioned above, plan to wall-mount the camera, and remember to never turn the parent unit on near your sleeping baby, this is actually a pretty good video monitor. Otherwise, it's just not.--Update - down to one star:After about 12 hours of use over 3 days, my camera has stopped working properly. It cycles randomly between day and night modes (1-20 seconds in one mode before flipping to the other), even if the room is so dark that on night mode the screen just shows blackness. Unplugging the camera and plugging it back in fixes the problem for an hour or two. I haven't yet contacted tech support, since they're only available by phone, and with a newborn in the house i have precious little time for phone calls, especially when i don't know if it will take 30 seconds or 30 minutes.--Another update:I got an email from a vendor kindly offering to replace my obviously malfunctioning unit. They claim it should _not_ interfere with wi-fi, despite operating on a frequency known to interfere with wi-fi. I'm not going to bother getting the replacement, primarily because the other issues (some of which aren't malfunctions, like the annoying start-up sound) render this monitor useless to me.In addition, i did some experimenting and found that the range of this monitor is less than 50 feet in my house. There are only two walls between my kitchen and the nursery, and probably less than 50 feet, but at my kitchen table the monitor repeatedly cuts out saying it lost signal. Maybe this is yet another aspect of its malfunction, but at the point where a monitor is malfunctioning in three apparently unrelated ways (wi-fi interference, day/night mode switch, and range), it suggests a certain lack of quality in the product.--A third update:I have a 3037 unit as well, the fancier pan-tilt-zoom version. It also interferes with wi-fi. If the wi-fi interference really is a malfunction, then it's a common one across at least two product lines, which seems unlikely.

Reviews.Title: Unfortunately, Samsung disappoints with this product!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Bryant
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am extremely disappointed in this product. As parents, we put a lot of faith in the reliability of a monitor. After all, they act as our "eyes" in the room when we cannot be right there.I chose this product because I am loyal to the samsung brand. I have never had any problems from my samsung tv's, cameras or printers. This time...Samsung disappoints!I have had my monitor for 9 months and it hasn't worked properly from day one.  I have gotten up in the night numerous times to find my screen has frozen and I have to turn it off and on. I am a new mommy, so this can be frightening and cause panic. The range is terrible. I will be directly beside the camera and it beeps out of range, so stepping outside is out of the question for sure!  The night vision camera worked in the beginning, but that didn't last. Now, all I see at night is blurry and dark. I guess the positive side is, I can still hear him.And forget calling customer service!  There isn't am option for this product, nor can they find the product number online!I truly am disappointed for the first time ever with this Samsung product!

Reviews.Title: Worked for 1 night and that was it...
Reviews.Author: CFFP
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit a few months ago. It worked ok when I used it for the baby naps (meaning it worked for a couple hours a day). When it was time to move the baby to his room, I used the VOX feature and it worked perfectly the first night.However, the second night I turned it on and it said "out of range". We tried pairing it up for hours but were not able to...I took it to a Samsung Authorized Center and they told me the PCB Main (some sort of card) had to be replaced but they don't even have the part number.I ended up buying a new unit, another brand of course. I can't believe an almost $200 unit worked for only 1 night.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic monitor and wonderful gift!
Reviews.Author: Larissa L. Hewitt
Reviews.Content: We recently received this monitor as a baby shower gift and absolutely love it!  Very easy to use and setup, which has been much appreciated as the days to our little one's arrival tick down!  While we haven't had the chance to use it with our actual baby yet, the night vision and day vision both seem excellent, and we're certain this monitor will go a long way toward us getting a restful night in the midst of many other causes for sleeplessness!

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG SEW-3036WN
