Reviews.Content: Good Afternoon!In the month of MARCH-2013 had purchased the following product 'Samsung SEW-3036WN Wireless Video Baby Monitor with Infrared Night Vision and now I get NO SIGNAL on the monitor, much agraderia they can help me solve the problem

Reviews.Title: Terrific baby monitor - very pleased with functionality - but serious design flaw!
Reviews.Author: TBT
Reviews.Content: I have now had this monitor for 7 months and even purchased the expandable camera for our newborn, so we are now able to monitor both children on the same monitor.  Setup was very easy and everything I originally stated below holds true.HOWEVER, about every week (give or take a few days), the monitor displays an 'out of range' message for both cameras and I have to pair both cameras to the monitor again.  While not difficult, it sort of defeats the purpose of the monitor...which is to monitor.  When we finally get our infant down to sleep, then go downstairs and turn on the monitor and no image shows up, we don't want to go back into the room to disturb the peacefully sleeping little guy...at least not for a good few minutes.So I called Samsung tech support thinking this was a defective unit and hoping to exchange it, and the representative told me this is how the monitor is designed!  So this is actually a design flaw.  Apparently, if there is any interference, the monitor drops the camera and you have to manually pair again.  I would think it a simple matter to save the radio frequency settings in memory so once you move the monitor closer or the interference clears, the video returns automatically without the need to pair again.Samsung, fix this issue and your product rating will improve dramatically!+++++++++++++++++++++++We just received the Samsung SEW-3036 video baby monitor and as soon as I turned it on, I was impressed.  The display is large and the image quality is incredibly clear.  What impressed me most was just how clear the image quality is in both light and dark environments - there is a light sensor on the camera that detects lighting and switches the camera from normal light (full color video) to minimal/no light (black and white video utilizing the infrared LEDs).  Also, setup of the camera and monitor is super simple (however, if you are not handy with technology, you should read the manual to dig into the menu settings...but it's all really pretty straightforward once you become familiar with it).We now have two children and purchased this for our newborn who is just 1 week old.  After seeing the quality, we will likely ditch our old monitor we were using for our first child and simply purchase an additional camera since the Samsung is expandable and sounds very easy to connect the additional camera to the monitor -- simply hit the 'pairing' button on each device and you're all set.  What's nice is that the monitor itself has a scan feature so the video/audio will switch between the cameras automatically every 10 seconds.I would have given this product a 5 star rating, but I literally took it out of the box today, so would want some more time with it before giving it a perfect score.  Also, while the camera is very easy to mount (there is even a mounting template included in the instruction manual) and you can pivot the camera to multiple angles, the camera is vertically aligned while the monitor is horizontally aligned.  It would be perfect if you had the option to turn the camera 90 degrees so that the length of the crib fit into the longest viewing dimension of the camera and thus the monitor.  It's not a major factor since you can simply mount the camera on a different wall to achieve the same 90 degree angle, but if you only have one wall option for mounting, you may have to mount the camera farther back to get everything in frame. Fortunately, the monitor also comes with a 2x zoom and pan feature so even if you are farther back, you can always zoom in to get a closer look.I would also recommend that the monitor stand should pivot 90 degrees so you have the option of setting the monitor down on either its horizontal or vertical edge.All things considered, these are pretty minor improvements and it would not have prevented me from purchasing this monitor.  Like I said, I'll likely get the second add on camera to place in our other child's room...so we just have one monitor to carry around.  What's nice too is that there is a VOX setting that turns off the display to conserve batter, but automatically turns on when a noise is sensed by the respective camera...and you can adjust the sensitivity (hi/low) to pick up the slightest sound or only the big cries.Lastly, there's even a talk button on the monitor so you can use it like a walkie-talkie if you need to soothe with your voice or communicate with your spouse from another floor.  Even the volume of the speaker on each camera can be individually controlled and set all from the monitor.  Really useful and well-thought-out device.

Reviews.Title: It is a good camera
Reviews.Author: Ski Fanatic
Reviews.Content: I have a 3 year old and I just bought this camera to replace the one that I bought when he was born. It was aSummer Infant and I loved it but the plugs stop working and after 3 years of having it lasted a long time for nowadays...PROS of this camera:- The talk feature great which my other camera didn't have- Sleep button works great as well- Good quality and easy set up- Good rangeCONS:- My Summer Infant had the feature that you could move the camera all throughout the room and see different corners of the room. This Camera doesn't do that. You can press the zoom button and then move the video camera but very little and only in zoom mode. The area where you move the camera is very limited and that is the main reason why I give it 4 stars.- The sound could be a little bit louder. Sometimes is hard to hear.Unlike some people that have reviewed this camera I haven't had any issues with the wifi. Everything in my house is wifi and this camera hasn't interfered with anything.Overall is a good camera and it is easy to use, but if you are looking for a camera that you can see all around the room this is not the one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent monitor
Reviews.Author: CRP Ag
Reviews.Content: As parents of a 6 month old, we are probably over protective.  We loved the idea of a video monitor.  Being able to hear your baby cry is all well and good, but what if he or she is in trouble and not making much noise, being able to see what is happening is priceless.This monitor is very effective.  The quality if simply excellent.  The picture quality is great, the image is clear as a bell.  I love the night vision mode, in a dark room, you can still see your baby very well.  We have had no issues with interference or disruption of the signal at all.  We can always hear and see what is going on.I highly recommend this monitor.  If you only have an audio monitor now, you will love the added feeling of security with this monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great video & audio quality
Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: Very lightweight, easy to use and portable. Battery life on the monitor is excellent. A bit pricey but believe it is still a great value. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: So Easy to Use..!
Reviews.Author: Skyfox
Reviews.Content: So a friend of mine got me this when I had my twins and at first I didn't really think I needed a baby monitor. Never been real good with machines and gadgets, thought about maybe returning it and getting something else I can get more use out of. To make the long story short, my husband convinced me I give it a try and now I can't live without this thing. As most mothers would know, having a newborn can be a scary experience, and I've been blessed with 2 of them. Although I want to be with them 24/7, the reality is I can't and whenever I feel insecure about my babies, this thing gives me assurance for their safety. I can be on the other side of the house but I'll know they are ok when I see my babies on the monitor. Like I said, I don't' know much about machines and gadgets and even for a newbie like me, this monitor was so easy to learn and use. If I can use it, anyone can use it. I highly recommend this monitor and with name like Samsung, its been nothing but reliable.

Reviews.Title: SEW-3036 unneeded stuff gone, only the good things left!
Reviews.Author: Reviewer "philcyberia"
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this nice and short. SEW-3036 is the baby monitor where they eliminated all the unnecessary functions you almost never use, and boosted up the functions that's actually useful and most essential. First of all, its coverage was vamped up to whopping 800ft, which I'm most happy about. This is more than twice the range many of Samsung's previous models, and it definitely gives me more freedom to do other things whilst keeping my eye on my daughter in the house. I'm also loving its 3.5" LCD screen. I believe Samsung's other 3.5" baby monitors cost over $200, this one is only $179. I guess they were able to cut down the price by removing all the unused functions from the previous models (such as temperature sensors, etc..), and I have no complaints about that. My honest opinion is for a Samsung product, its definitely a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Excellent baby monitor....
Reviews.Author: Confucious
Reviews.Content: This baby monitor was super easy to set up and use. Just take it out of the package and charge the display before using it. I had the camera plugged in and thought I was charging it. I thought it was wireless but it is not. That needs to be plugged in at all times. It is easy to swap the camera from being on a table top to hanging it on the wall. Once the display is charged you are ready to go. You literally just turn it on and you are good to go. The display has an easy to follow menu. You can also add extra cameras and switch between cameras on the display. You can mute sound or change the volume too. The display is bright and clear. You can see whats on the screen pretty clear. It does excellent in the night or in low light conditions too. Battery last a good while too. You can also sleep the screen and still get sound to conserve battery life. Overall a great product that functions like it is supposed to and easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Jinah
Reviews.Content: Pretty good I will get it out that this is my first baby monitor so I cannot compare this one to other ones; however, I have been using this baby monitor for a couple of days now and it has been working pretty good. I don't have any complaints about it. If I do it would be that it is on the pricy side. But I guess you get what you paid for. Samsung is a name brand company so putting their name on a product would give more confidence to the consumers. So all in all, I like this baby monitor and did not give me any problems at all, so far

Reviews.Title: Great Video Monitor, Thank you Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: I Love this monitor. I had an audio monitor and didn't know what I was missing. The monitor is easy to set up and simple to use! It has a beautiful video image and audio is just a clear as my audio monitor. I love it that I can connect up to four cameras with this kit and plan to buy more cameras to set up different rooms with it.  It's a great buy and I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time or money!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very excited to get this. That excitement was very short lived. The crisp clear image it claims to have was any thing but. The Picture was so bleached our baby's crib which is a dark brown  showed up as a light baby blue. The night vision was horrible. They claim it can see up 8 feet at night but we couldn't see into the crib just 3 feet away. I will never buy another Samsung product again. All the positive feedback this thing has received has to be fabricated.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: Lewis
Reviews.Content: Good camera however the problem issue we encountered with model even after a second return and new one try was that the IR night vision will not hold a picture and will only flash a picture for 3 secs and then go black for 5-7 secs and then start the same cycle. Seems to be a glitch and after trying a replacement found the same issue to occur. Sorry to be bearer of bad news but other cameras hold a steady picture in both modes.

Reviews.Title: Second time's a charm--Edited 3/5/2013
Reviews.Author: A. Emens
Reviews.Content: This would have been a great monitor.  I need one with a VOX feature, and this has it, plus a lot of other features my old (now broken) Infant Optics monitor didn't have.  So I was disappointed to find that as soon as we plugged it in, we started seeing the same defect that several other reviewers complained about--the night vision blinks in and out.  So you can see your kid for a few seconds, then the screen goes black (because the room is dark, duh), and then it comes back on for a few seconds, repeatedly, for as long as you have the video function engaged.  I called Samsung and they were polite but completely useless.  This is getting returned, unfortunately.EDITED 3/5/2013Samsung called me and offered an additional 1 year warranty if I changed my review, but I had been considering changing it anyway...So we returned this monitor and took a gamble by re-ordering the same one.  So far so good.  The blinking isn't happening with this one, but we've only been using it for a few days.  I've updated to 3 stars.  It's really more like a 3.5. We're happy with a lot of the functionality--I really like the VOX feature and the sleep mode.  However, for the price, the picture quality isn't great. Our previous baby monitor (Infant Optics DXR-5 2.4 GHz Digital Video Baby Monitor with Night Vision) was much cheaper, and though the screen was smaller, the picture was much clearer in night vision.  With this one, I can't even tell if she's got her pacifier in most of the time. Also, last night after baby was in bed, I turned the monitor on to discover it was "out of range" even though I was 15 feet from the camera.  Turns out it had come unpaired somehow.  I had to sneak in and push a button on the camera to fix it.  Hopefully that's a one-time issue, though I will say it's way too easy to unpair the camera through the menu.  I'm not sure whether that's what happened this time or not. Anyway, we're liking it more and more, but it could be better.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Weltschmerz
Reviews.Content: We bought this on Amazon from Soltech Security before our newborn arrived despite some of the negative reviews about the night vision and range issues.  When we first started using the device, we had some of the problems that other reviewers have mentioned about the night vision not being consistent -- it would constantly flicker between night vision and regular vision in a dark room during the day but was fine at night, so I guess the sensor is very sensitive to ANY light.  Too bad you can't set it manually.  Frustrating, but we could live with that as we could still see what was going on in the room, albeit in at times irksome flashes.  Then after 3 months the camera and monitor wouldn't connect, and the monitor consistently beeped and said out of range, even with the camera and monitor two feet apart.  Turns out that it needed to be reset.  You go to menu, toggle over to the circle with the arrow and move it to yes.  A 30 second countdown will start on the monitor, and then you just need to hit the pairing button on the camera.  It worked for me!  If you have any trouble, you can call Samsung at 877-349-3149, they were great and helped me get the monitor back in business!

Reviews.Title: Constantly switching from night to day
Reviews.Author: Snlblondie
Reviews.Content: It's sad that we are advised to put black tape over the sensor to stop the constant switching from night mode to day. It seems like these monitors sold for the black friday deal were faulty. I'm so annoyed.

Reviews.Title: "Out of Range"?!?
Reviews.Author: Kevin Born-Crow
Reviews.Content: Picture quality not all terribly great, especially given that it's a Samsung device and you'd think the tech would be bigger. Especially when zoomed in, the picture quality got even worse.But the bigger problem...We read reviews about the problem happening where the screen goes blank and just says "Out of Range" inexplicably, but hoped it was just a fluke in some other people's units. Well upon the very first use, this is exactly what happened with ours, even when we were only one floor directly below our toddler's bedroom where the camera was located. We "paired" the camera and the monitor unit just as directed, and followed all the troubleshooting advice for the picture not showing. But the "Out of Range" error message persisted no matter what. It makes this device quite useless and a waste of money. We quickly returned it, now trying out a Summer Infant version instead.

Reviews.Title: Works great - but DESTROYS your home wifi!
Reviews.Author: Vaetix
Reviews.Content: This works great - possibly too great.  It does everything it claims to and more - the "more" being that it completely overpowers your home's wifi network, rendering it useless.

Reviews.Title: Buggy
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Peterson
Reviews.Content: This monitor struggles. From day one it cuts in and out and give you this annoying beep when it disconnects. The text on the unit describing what buttons do wore off after a month or two. The sound has cut out intermittently also. I would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch System at Great Price
Reviews.Author: Heavy C
Reviews.Content: I got this system to replace my internet-based system which ran through my phone.  This system is super reliable both in terms of picture, sound, and night vision.  I would recommend it to anyone and will be buying these for relatives who have kids in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great start.... Lousy finish
Reviews.Author: Michelle Williams
Reviews.Content: I had this monitor for all of two months.  I had the same night vision probs everyone else complains about, but aside from this.... Ridiculously glitchy: switches btwn cameras on its own, turns off without even touching it,  battery life is crap.  This monitor is absolutely not worth the nearly two hundred bucks I spent on it.  Save yourself the money

Reviews.Title: Works well, but so far I wish I had just gotten a sound monitor
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Lewis
Reviews.Content: This does work well, but I find myself thinking did I really need this expensive thing?  I really only listen for the noises so far and never really need the picture.  Maybe later on I will be glad to have the picture.

Reviews.Title: Samsung did it again! Love this product!
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I research quite extensively with baby monitors and noticed that most flaws are really common problem across most lines of baby monitors. Since I've had a great deal of experience with the Samsung brand, I decided to give this unit a try. Well, I could not be happier with this monitor. The picture quality and simple interface made this product great. I would surely recommend this product to anyone who is considering purchasing a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: I got a defective one
Reviews.Author: mazda
Reviews.Content: Video monitor almost works perfectly - range is good, battery life is good, screen is adequate, nice features like mute and two-way intercom.  However, like a few of the other "negative" reviewers my unit keeps flashing between night vision and normal vision at night (so at night the sceen comes on and blanks out every 3 seconds).  Very annoying to say the least! I tried the black tape trick to block the light sensor (under the on/off switch) which solved the flashing problem but created a new problem in that the video is now black & white during the day.  I would send it back for a refund and try the Motorola model instead..

Reviews.Title: Enh
Reviews.Author: Octavia Wilde "Scourge of Carpathia"
Reviews.Content: First I have to ask: why would you make a thing whose use implies that a baby is sleeping sound an incredibly loud song when switched on with no way of muting? We have to shove this thing under a pillow to switch it on.IR cuts in and out constantly. Image freezes a lot, and often it suddenly goes out of range.

Reviews.Title: Another Quality product from Samsung
Reviews.Author: Scott Sisk
Reviews.Content: Great 3.5" display, good range , and the amount of sound from babies room that the camera is able to pick up is superb. Even in minimal light the night vision is clear, looks like a black and white photo. I would recommend this camera to any one considering it.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons for the SEW-3036
Reviews.Author: jong ha jin
Reviews.Content: Pros:VOX featureScan featurePicture qualityNight visionDecent connectionCons:Start up soundConnectionLast time I checked, 5 beats 2 so even though the start up sound can be annoying and there is some connection issue, it still is a good baby monitor. So it is a winner in my book. (4 star)

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: vince faville
Reviews.Content: Nice and small so its easy to carrying around with you and the pan and zoom is cool.  we replaced a big 5" tube monitor so this allot more convenient.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Maximus
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a decent product and works well. The resolution of the screen is pretty low. Also the colors arent that bright!C'mon Samsung, you know what to do!!!

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: ahmad
Reviews.Content: My wonderful Dhu'l excellent quality and fast delivery, excellent choiceThere're a lot of choices out there but I stumbled on Samsung video monitors.

Reviews.Title: Decent Enough Video Monitor, A Few Minor Annoyances...
Reviews.Author: E. Stell "optipro2020"
Reviews.Content: As many precious reviewers have already mentioned, when you initially start up the monitor there is a very loud, obnoxious and superfluous (and cheap sounding) tone that sounds. That "feature" could have been left off and saved us a little $$$.Also the device "UN pairs" a little too easily causing you to have to re pair it by pushing a button on the camera that is dangerously close to a LIGHTLY sleeping infant that will easily awaken if you BREATHE the wrong way.The fact that the buttons are almost flush to the monitor is NOT a bonus especially if you are fumbling around half asleep trying to adjust something or hit the menu.The zoom function is annoying because the zoom angle you work so hard to zero in on centering your little one in has to be re-centered every time you switch between 1X and 2X zoom. It's just time consuming to have to toggle toggle toggle over to the left or right or up or down to center your little one EVERY time you hit the zoom function.The belt clip and especially the kickstand feel very cheaply made like if I were to slightly over-extend the kickstand piece it would break right off. I guess I'm lucky this device even comes with a kickstand!Pros:Good but not great picture quality.,Appears to have a functional infrared for night vision.Ease of set-up.All in all a very good monitor, despite my grievances. I just wish a little more thought (from a consumer's standpoint) would have gone into this baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: very basic, easy baby monitor
Reviews.Author: morning fog
Reviews.Content: This is very basic baby monitor that's expandable (with up to 4 cameras). Just like any other basic baby monitor from other companies, this one supports two way talk and night vision up to 15 feet. The built quality is ok. It is plastic and light; both camera and the monitor unit are not too heavy and not too bulky. The design is mostly plain. I liked the fact that the camera base part is heavy and mountable. I can also position the camera any angle I want. The monitor unit is a little bit bigger and thicker than the size of iPhone and has a kick stand + belt clip in the back. The belt clip is ok, but not the kick stand. The stand feels too weak if I pull on it with some force; I am certain the stand will break easily. One thing I found interesting was that the design is very similar to Lorex's wireless video home monitor system (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008EIKU3C). I don't know if Samsung copied Lorex's model or vise versa, but many of these baby monitors do look alike when one is looking through the shelves in the baby monitor section of Babies"R"Us.So how does the monitor work? From the minute I turned the device on, I knew I would easily understand each function; it was pretty self explanatory. The wireless camera and the monitor already came paired, so I didn't have to do anything. Despite the 3.5" LCD screen size, the resolution wasn't that great day and night (it's only 320x240 pixels). The wireless range was good. I didn't have any problem receiving the video signal from one side to the other side of my house. I just had to take the antenna out on the monitor. Also I did not have any WIFI interferences during use. I have both 2.4 and 5 GHz WIFI running at home with at least ten wireless devices connected and everything worked fine. I found that the battery on the monitor lasted a couple of hours, but it does have a sleep button to conserve battery power if I want to turn off the screen. The audio is still active and picks up sound during the sleep mode as well.Overall, this is very basic baby monitor. There is nothing fancy about this monitor in any aspects such as feature or design. Having said that, in my opinion, this baby monitor is priced too high for what it is. There are many baby monitors with similar features for less money, or you can find better equipped home monitor systems for under $200 these days. There are many alternatives that you can use your existing iPhone or android phone for less spending as well. However, if you just want a simple and basic baby monitor, this will do the job.

Reviews.Title: Excellent delivery
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: Wow I purchased this item on Thursday, and I received it on Monday even though UPS does not work on weekends. It was well packaged and this baby monitor works great. This is my second baby monitor and it is definitely better than my Sony one. Thanks for the quick shipment Soltech!

Reviews.Title: Not that great!
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: If you are going through what I've been going through looking for a nice colored video monitor, then I'm here to help you once in for all & save you the trouble and disappointment of buying and returning. This camera here was my second to last choice after going through many many cameras. Including all the summer ones and even the camera for the iPhone. I went through 5 before this one and got no where my last options was this one or the Motorola Digital Video Baby Monitor with 3.5" Color Screen and Wireless Camera - MBP 34. I'm telling you now this camera was TERRIBLE!!! The color and Resolution was so bad I couldn't even tell if my baby's eyes were open. It looks like night vision with the lights on. Everything looks purple and grey. I was so disgusted!! It's blurry and so not crispy for what it costed. I went straight back out and returned and got my last and final camera choice. The Motorola Digital Video Baby Monitor with 3.5" Color Screen. Now finally!!! This is it!! If you wanna save the trouble just go out and buy this one it's 209 dollars and worth every penny! Crispy beautiful color I can zoom up so close I can see if my baby is breathing I mean its wonderful. The biggest mistake I made was buying and not checking reviews or even the store that sold this monitors on so you can check them out yourself. Babiesrus is we're I found this one and got to test it out before hand and I wish I would've just listen to my gut instinct and bought this one from the get! It's only a few more dollars and its everything I know you fellow searchers are looking for. So don't waste your time on any other moniter. Get the Motorola Digital Video Baby Monitor with 3.5" Color Screen and Wireless Camera - MBP 34

Reviews.Title: A Really Reliable Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: solo
Reviews.Content: I just had a baby one year ago. Every day I need to take care of my baby at home. However, I usually feel worried especially when I cook the dinner in the kitchen and suddenly everything becomes quiet, because I can't see what he is doing. Until one day I saw this baby monitor online and purchased it immediately. When I got this product, its performance really shocked me. The image is of very high quality and can keep the high quality even at a distance. For example, when I leave my baby in the bedroom and I go out to water my followers, I can still see him and talk to him. Its night version also helps me a lot. After I got this product I didn't need to get up and walk a few meters to his cradle at night. What I need to do was pressing the power button, watching his lovely face in the dark, and then continuing sleeping even without turning it off because it can go to sleep automatically in 1 min and wake up when there is noise. It's really attractive both in price and quality.

Reviews.Title: not liked
Reviews.Author: Moacir Ernesto Mariani
Reviews.Content: The product was below expectation. I have one of another brand that is better. I'm sorry. Not recommend this product to anyone

Reviews.Title: BAD out of the box...
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: wow where to start.. it was bad right out of the box. I was so excited to try this monitor and really wanted to like it. well the least i can say is i was very sadly disappointed. it was bad right out of  the box. as soon as i got it plugged up and turned on it gave me the out of range picture and i never could get it to go away. Needless to say i only kept it about 4 hours and quickly returned it to the store for the summer infant touch screen one.

Reviews.Title: baby shower
Reviews.Author: NEM
Reviews.Content: purchased this for a friend of mine.. they havent used it yet.. but shipping was extremely fast and the item looks great.. im pretty sure there wont be any issues.

Reviews.Title: Bummer
Reviews.Author: KWright
Reviews.Content: I am a first time Mom and had no idea which monitor to choose. From the reviews, I felt that this monitor must be the best. Does it do the job? Absolutely! Are there things I'm frustrated about? Absolutely.Ill focus on the positive first. The screen is great and the infrared vision in a dark room is great. I do appreciate that I can roll over in bed and make sure my baby is breathing.Now there are a few things that I'm very frustrated with. 1) The camera monitor (the one that stays in the baby's room) has a short cord so be prepared to mount it close to an outlet. Not all homes have outlets on all four walls so this may affect how you decorate your nursery 2) The battery life for the parents monitor (the one you hold) is way too short. This has a relatively long cord which is nice but it only lasts a few hours when not plugged in. That is not very helpful when you wake up to a black screen b/c the battery died. Ugh. 3) I get frustrated every night because there is a very annoying and loud tune that the parents monitor plays when you turn it on? What is Samsung thinking? Isn't the purpose of a monitor to watch a SLEEPING baby. Why would you have such a loud on/off tune when the baby is sleeping. There is no way to turn the sound off and I cringe every night when I turn it on.I'm just venting b/c I see room for improvement on what could be the perfect monitor. My next monitor will have a longer battery life and no loud noises when I turn it on.

Reviews.Title: I am satisfied
Reviews.Author: Kata Kovary
Reviews.Content: Samsung is one of my favorite companies we have Samsung TV, smartphone and camera, so I decided to try out their baby monitor.  It was easy to install and the video quality is good. I can easily check my 2ys old girl, she is sleeping or running around in her room. :-)

Reviews.Title: Parents' worst nightmare.
Reviews.Author: JKP
Reviews.Content: You know how one of the things you're afraid of as a new parent is that you won't wake up when your baby cries? That happened thanks to this monitor. My husband and I woke up in the middle of the night to realize that our baby has been crying for we don't know how long and this monitor just lost its sound function. Just all of a sudden, no sound!!! We are absolutely horrified. We have no idea how long our baby had cried for. This is just terrible. Aside from that, it also has the blinking defect where at night the screen turns black every 2-3 seconds. We tries calling Samsung, spent over an hour on the phone but with no use. They told us to call back. As new parents, we don't exactly have the time to spend hours on the phone with them. What an awful waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing repair policy / Samsung vs. Motorola
Reviews.Author: VZ
Reviews.Content: Was initially very happy with this Samsung monitor, but it stopped working after 3 days. It constantly flipped back and forth between day and night modes every few seconds, no matter what the light level was in the room, making the monitor unusable.Called up Samsung and they told me that the camera was broken, manufacturer's defect, and offered to fix it. They were very nice on the phone, only catch is that they would need to keep it for at least 2 days, and possibly even a week to fix and send back, without any substitute or replacement. We could not sleep without a monitor for our infant for even a night so this was not an option for us as we had no backup. I told them this and they said there was nothing they could do--company policy. I told them I would have to go out and buy another monitor, I couldn't wait on them for up to a week without a monitor.This may have just been an isolated incident, but I did see at least two other posts complaining of this same problem. I tried putting black tape over the light sensor, as one user recommended, but this did not fix the problem. There's also no way to manually set it on day or night mode, so it would just continuously flicker and blink, obscuring the video.Called Amazon and they graciously allowed us to return the item so we could buy a new one. (This was amazing, thank you Amazon!!)Got a Motorola instead and have had it for a few weeks now. Very happy with the new one. Wanted to post on here to save people a little headache in case they are looking for a monitor, a few points of comparison between Samsung and Motorola:1. The Motorola allows you to pan and tilt with the receiver so you do not need to go in the baby's room to position the camera.2. The zoom in feature on the Motorola is much clearer as is the overall picture quality. On the Samsung it was ok, but a bit blurry and the night mode was very grainy relative to the Motorola.3. The audio quality on the Motorola is ok, but I think the Samsung might be marginally better.4. The Motorola does NOT make any startup sound. The Samsung makes a very loud startup tune, which is annoying and can also wake up the baby/parents. There's no way to turn off the startup tune.5. The stand for the Motorola is a bit sturdier, but the Samsung is about the same, flimsier plastic though on the Samsung.6. The screen on the Samsung is slightly larger, but does not matter because the picture quality is so much crisper on the Motorola. On the Motorola I can actually see my baby's face and body moving, on the Samsung I could not see that level of detail.7. The menu navigation is equally good with both monitors.8. The buttons on both monitors are configured differently, so some people may prefer one over the other, but I was fine with either.9. The price was virtually the same for both--at the time of writing about $180 for either one. So price did not sway either way.Bottom line, if the Samsung works, I'm sure it's a fine monitor, not the best, but functional. Ultimately, their return/repair policy was not acceptable, but Amazon saved the day, and could not be happier with the new Motorola monitor. Thanks again Amazon!
